Two years ago Paulo opened a small grocery stand near his house, where he sells food, drinks and basic needs. Beer is the most wanted item. His wife runs the stand from 7:00am to 7:00pm and they make around MTn 800 and MTn 1,000 per day.

The mother of Paulo’s wife got sick a few months ago and stopped walking. Paulo and his family decided to move to a smaller house for MTn500 and rented out their house for MTn800.This helps them pay all the medical expenses. The grocery stand business also suffered in these last few months, as just a little money was available to buy inventory. Knowing Hluvuku since they opened their branch office in Namaacha in early 2007, Paulo decided to ask for a loan of MTn 7,000 to buy inventory and keep the grocery stand opened.

Paulo is hopeful that he will get a job as a bakery driver and will soon increase his income. In the future, Paulo would like to ask for another loan to keep improving the grocery stand, and eventually build his own carpentry to work with wood.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Alejandro Anastasio

texts.es:
Mr. Alejandro Torres has been a farmer for two years, owning his own farm in the El Sauce area of León city in Nicaragua. He is a married father with responsibility of supporting his three children who need the unconditional support of their mother and father.

For quite a while he has been farming. Previously he worked on a farm that wasn’t his but now he owns his own farm which he runs, raising cattle. Today this gentleman finds himself in need of buying calves to raise. Therefore he is seeking financial help from Ceprodel, who a few months ago supported him with loans to buy his cattle, thereby enabling him to support his family by working in agriculture and cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Alejandro T. desde hace dos años se dedica al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propio local en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Es padre casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos que necesitan del apoyo incondicional de su padre y madre.

Por mucho tiempo ha tenido experiencia en el trabajo de agricultura ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una finca que no era propia pero ahora que posee su propia finca la administra junto con el ganado que posee. Hoy en día, la necesidad que este caballero atraviesa es la compra de vaquillas para la crianza de estas. Por este motivo busca financiamiento en Ceprodel quien desde hace varios meses le ha apoyado con prestamos para la compra de su ganado y así continuar manteniendo a su familia por medio del trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería .

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
In the El Sauce area of León city, Mr. Alejandro M. has raised cattle since he was a youth, so he has a lot of experience in the business which has been the way he has supported his home. Today he is the father of six children who feel grateful to have a responsible and hardworking father

His wife has been a great help to Mr. M. by always supporting him in the business, and she has given him all her support in the home and by taking care of the children. In order to improve their quality of life Mr. M. needs to buy cattle, so he is seeking the support of Ceprodel for a loan that will enable him to move his business forward, enabling him to buy animals in order to later sell them. He has three previous loans with Ceprodel which have been paid according to the agreed upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, el señor Alejandro M. se dedica al negocio de la ganadería desde su juventud teniendo una alta experiencia en este negocio que ha sido el sostén de su hogar desde que trabaja en ello. Hoy en día es padre de seis hijos que se sienten muy agradecidos de tener un padre responsable y trabajador.

Su esposa ha sido una ayuda idónea para el señor M. por el hecho de que siempre le ha apoyado en el negocio y le ha brindado todo su apoyo en el hogar y cuido de los hijos. Para mejorar su condición de vida el señor M. requiere la compra de ganado por lo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita salir adelante y de esta manera comprar los animales para su respectiva comercialización. Hoy en dia su record crediticio es de 3 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban G. has had a farming business since he was young. He has his own land which he plants, cares for and harvests. To do so, he has a small shed at his house where he keeps the tools he needs for his field work, such as shovels, plows, reaper, and others.

Esteban has a family of 4 children and feels a duty to give them the education they deserve. In order to improve his economic condition he has requested a loan from CEPRODEL which will allow him to buy resources to protect and preserve the harvest. He currently has a record of 3 loans from CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Esteban G. se dedica al negocio de agricultura desde su juventud teniendo sus propios terrenos los cuales los trabaja en la siembra, cuido, sanidad y siega del cultivo. Para ello cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su casa donde posee las herramientas necesarias para el trabajo en el campo destacándose entre ellas palas, maquinas de arado, pequeñas maquinas de extracción, y otros en general.

El señor Esteban es padre de familia y con la responsabilidad de 4 hijos que está en el deber de proporcionarle los estudios que estos se merecen. Para mejorar su condición económica ha solicitado crédito en CEPRODEL que le permita la adquisición de recursos económicos para la compra de la cosecha, compra de preservantes y productos de cuido de dicha cosecha. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 3 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Invest in his agricultural business.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe Martinez is married with 5 children. He works in agriculture, in the municipality of El Sauce where he has a small ranch. His ranch is located quite far from his house and he has to travel there by horse, which is the main means of transportation in this area.

Because he is a very responsible person, he has worked in this business for most of his life. It generates a small income for maintaining his home and his children. In order to improve this situation and provide a better standard of living to his family, Mr. Martinez has decided to request a loan from Ceprodel so that he can purchase some pregnant cows, from which he can get milk to sell and later on, sell the calves.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Felipe Martinez es un caballero casado y con 5 hijos a su deber. Se dedica en el municipio El Sauce al negocio de agropecuario teniendo su propia finca y por el hecho de estar ubicada muy alejado de su casa de habitación, debe de trasladarle hacia ella cabalgando un caballo que es su medio de transporte en esta localidad.

Por ser una persona muy responsable, ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a este negocio el cual le genera bajos ingreso para la mantención de su hogar y de sus hijos. Para mejorar esta situación y consiente de que debe de proporcionar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, el señor Martinez ha decidido solicitar crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de dar lugar a la compra de vacas en preñez para así extraer de ellas la leche para su respectiva venta y luego comercializar sus productos derivados de este animal.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto R. is a hard-working man who is in agriculture. He has his own ranch in the municipality of El Sauce in León. He has worked at this business for a long time and acquired his abilities in ranching and farming when he was very young.

He is a married father with responsibilities for maintaining his four school-age children. He is known as being very responsible and hard-working, since every day very early in the morning he starts his job taking care of his fields while at the same time raising cattle in his own pen located at his house.

Ceprodel has been the backbone of his business because of having granted loans which have allowed him to improve his standard of living through the acquisition of cattle and vegetables for planting. Today, once again, he trusts that his credit will be approved and he will be able to improve his business with the purchase of cattle and vegetables to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Gilberto R. es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propia finca en el municipio El Sauce de León. Se dedica al negocio desde hace mucho tiempo habiendo adquirido habilidades con los animales y el cultivo desde muy jovencito en su localidad de habitación.

Es padre acompañado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus cuatro hijos en edad escolar. Se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajadora puesto que todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su trabajo de agricultura en la siembra y cuido de la cosecha y a la vez en la crianza de ganado en un corral propio en su casa de habitación.

Ceprodel ha sido una columna fuerte en su negocio debido a que le ha otorgado créditos que le han permitido mejorar su condición de vida ya que ha adquirido el ganado y a la vez ha adquirido las hortalizas para la siembra. Hoy en día una vez mas confía en que su crédito será aprobado y podrá mejorar en su negocio con la compra del ganado y las hortalizas para la siembra.

loans.use: Purchase and raise cattle.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
Committed first and foremost to his family, and his business in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León, José Rodrígues works very hard at ranching. His has his own herd of cattle with which he works day after day to earn a living to support his dear wife and two children.

As every business requires investment, the business at which Mr. Rodrígues works needs to add some young bulls, which will be raised and sold. For this reason, once again he turns to Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will allow him to acquire the cattle and in this way, serve to help improve the standard of living of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Comprometido primeramente con su familia y con su negocio, en el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León, el señor José Rodrígues se dedica arduamente al trabajo ganadero teniendo su propio ganado con el que día a día se defiende para llevar el sustento a su querida esposa en conjunto con sus dos hijos.

Como todo negocio requiere inversión, el negocio al que se dedica el señor Rodrígues requiere la compra de novillo para su debida crianza y comercialización. Es por este motivo que muy confiadamente una ves mas acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir los novillos y de esta manera servir esto como apoyo para el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su amada familia.

loans.use: Purchase young bulls.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan R. is a native of the city of León in Nicaragua and he lives in the municipality of El Sauce. This is where he has his ranching business which allows him to support his family and provide for all the needs of his home.

Today Juan faces an urgent need to buy calves to raise. Because he does not have the economic means at this moment, he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel so he can purchase the cattle. He will be able to take full advantage of this purchase and commercialize them at the right time. He has had a total of 4 loans with CEPRODEL, all paid on time in accordance with their terms.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juan R. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua y habita en el municipio El Sauce que es donde posee su negocio ganadero con el que le permite dar mantenimiento a su familia supliendo todas las necesidades del hogar.

La necesidad que hoy en día el señor Juan atraviesa es la urgencia de la compra de vaquillas para su debida crianza. Por este motivo es que al no poseer ingresos económicos en este momento, solicita crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de las vaquillas. Con esta compra tiene lugar para sacarles el máximo provecho y extraer en tiempo oportuno sus derivados para comercializarlos. Hoy en día posee un total de 4 créditos con CEPRODEL pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es:
Lester E. is a young father of three children who works in ranching, specifically raising cows for selling milk in his area of town. Together with his wife and children, they work hard to feed and care for the cows, taking care that they are maintained in a healthy state and do not ingest any food that could be harmful.

Once the milk is extracted, they begin the process of selling it, which they do either from their house or door-to-door in their municipality. In order to improve their business, they have approached CEPRODEL to obtain a loan which will allow them to buy calves and in this way get ahead and continue to support the family.

Translated fro Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Lester E. es un joven padre de tres hijos que se dedica al trabajo de la ganadería específicamente en la crianza de vaquillas para la extracción de la leche para comercializarla en su sector de habitación. Junto con su esposa y sus hijos se esfuerza en el negocio alimentando al ganado y cuidándolo de que se mantenga puro y no vaya a ingerir algún alimento en descomposición o en mal estado.

Al extraer la leche inicia el proceso de venta el cual lo realiza en su casa de habitación o ambulantemente en las calles de su municipio. Para mejorar la condición del negocio ha acudido a CEPRODEL para obtener crédito que le permita la compra de las vaquillas y de esta manera salir adelante y continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise.

loans.name: Ramón Isidro

texts.es:
Ramón T. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce, in the city of León. Ever since he was young, he has raised animals. This is the only business he has ever worked in. He has his own cattle, and little by little over time he has been improving and expanding the business with the goal of improving his family´s standard of living and continuing to pay for his childrens´ education.

Ceprodel has been a fundamental part of Mr. T.´s ranching business for the fact of having provided loans which have been used to purchase calves and pregnant cows. Today, once again, Ramón faces this need, but he trusts that his loan will be granted to that he can help his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ramón T. es un caballero originario del municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Se dedica desde su juventud a la crianza de animales siendo el único negocio al que se dedica teniendo su propio ganado que poco a poco a través del tiempo lo ha venido mejorando y ampliando con la visión de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y continuar manteniendo los estudios de sus hijos.

Ceprodel ha sido un elemento fundamental en el negocio ganadero del señor T. por el hecho de que le ha brindado créditos que han sido utilizados para la compra del Ganado como vaquillas y vacas en preñes. Hoy en día una ves mas esta es la necesidad que atraviesa el señor Ramón pero confía en que su crédito le será otorgado para beneficio de su negocio y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ilusion Group

texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband on the Eastern peninsula of Samana, DR. She has raised three children (ages: 24, 25, 26) and now focuses on her small business. She sells new clothing from a small store, and with the money from this loan she wants to buy a fresh supply of clothes to add to her store. In her free time she enjoys reading, and her favorite food is fish. She hopes that in the future she will see the Dominican economy get stronger and stronger.

This will be the 4th loan that “Ilusion” has applied for with Esperanza, and they all appreciate the support of Kiva lenders that has maD. this possible. On behalf of Esperanza, thank you for investing in the lives of these borrowers. The impact will be sustained far into the future!

loans.use: To buy new clothes to add to her current merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in a greater variety of merchandise

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.en: Ms. Ayaba K. is 43 years old and the married mother of 1 child who is enrolled in school.  To provide for her family Ayaba sells ‘sandelettes,’ or flip-flops, and plastic containers in a small boutique located in the central market of Adéta.  These comfortable and inexpensive shoes and reliable, useful containers are very popular among the Togolese and are always in demand.  Ayaba is requesting this loan for two reasons: first, she would like to build a display for her merchandise to attract more customers and second, she hopes to buy more flip-flops and containers to increase the size of her business. She hopes that by increasing her commercial activity she can respond to the needs of her family and can continue to participate in the development of her community.

loans.use: To build a display for her merchandise (flip flops and plastic containers) and to increase her inventory

loans.name: Afi

texts.en: Afi A. is 50 years old and the married mother of a 26-year-old daughter.  Her daughter helps her in their boutique, which is located in the central market of Adéta.  Popular dress in Togo consists of a skirt and top cut and tailored from a length of fabric, and another length of fabric wrapped around the waist.  These pieces of fabric, which are vibrantly colored and lightweight, are called pagnes.  Selling pagnes is a popular business for women in Afi’s region, as they travel to Lomé, the capital, to purchase them to resell in the market in Adéta.  With her loan Afi hopes to send her daughter to Lomé to buy more pagnes in various prints and colors to increase her stock.  She also hopes that this trip will teach her daughter more about the business.  With the revenue generated from this expansion, Afi will be able to continue to provide for her daughter and her husband.

loans.use: To buy more pagnes (West African fabrics)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ami

texts.en: Ms. Ami K. is a young woman of 22 years who is recently married and does not yet have children.  She owns a small boutique in the central market of Adéta, a small village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She buys and resells plastic containers such as trash cans, jugs and other such items which are widely used here for a variety of purposes.  With this loan, Ami would like to diversify and grow her new business to increase the quality of life for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To diversify and expand her business by buying more plastic containers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Confort

texts.en: Ms. Confort A. is a friendly woman of 44 who lives and works in Adéta, Togo, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from the capital, Lomé.  Confort is married and the mother of 4 children who all go to school nearby.  To pay for her childrens’ education, Confort sells refreshing drinks and snacks in the central market in Adéta.  She has strategically placed her stand at the entrance to the market, to catch thirsty shoppers on their way in and out.  Confort specializes in Akpan Glacé, a traditional refreshing snack of soaked maize, which becomes soft and puffy, mixed with ice and sugar.  She also sells Citron Glacé, iced lemonade, which helps to quench shoppers’ thirsts on a hot Togolese afternoon.  Confort hopes to use her loan to buy more maize, sugar, ice, and lemons so that she can continue to run her refreshment stand, which allows her to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy maize, sugar, ice, and lemons

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaovi K. is 46 years old, married and the father of two children in school. He lives and works in the town of Adeta, about 20 miles from Kpalimé. He manages a pharmacy next to the town hospital and also a store that sells mosquito nets. He mainly sells anti-malaria drugs, contraceptives and medication for upset stomachs. He wants to use this loan to increase his stock of medicines in order to satisfy the ever-increasing demand of the local population. The profits from his business enable him to provide for his family and pay for the schooling of his two children.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr. Yaovi K. est âgé de 46 ans, marié et père de deux enfants à l’école .Il habite et travaille dans la ville d’ADETA , localité située environ trente kilomètre de Kpalimé. Il est gérant d’une pharmacie située près de l’hôpital de la ville et d’un magasin de vente de moustiquaires. Il vent principalement les médicaments contre le paludisme, les contraceptifs et les maux de ventre. Avec le présent emprunt il veut augmenter le stock de médicament afin de satisfaire les demandes sans cesse croissantes de la population. Le bénéfice tiré de son exploitation lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de payer la scolarité de ses deux enfants.

loans.use: To increase his supplies of medicine.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Señor De Exaltacion Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Tejada Zone lies a Focus Center with the same name, to which the Señor de Exaltacion Association and its 16 members belong to. This is a very pleasant and likeable group, being that aside from working together with the loan system that Pro-Mujer offers them, they all formed a very beautiful friendship.

There are several activities that the women of the association perform. One of them owns a store that sells provisions while others sell prepared meals, ice cream or potatoes, but the majority of them make clothing such as blouses, pants, dresses and other garments. These items are created by them.

They now need more capital to purchase imported fabrics and special equipment to expand their businesses and be able to offer their higher quality products outside of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “señor de exaltacion”que cuenta con 16 socias. Un grupo muy simpático ya que además de trabajar juntas con el sistema de créditos que Pro-Mujer les ofrece, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas. Son varias las actividades que realiza la asociación “, alguna de ellas tiene una tienda de víveres, otras socias venden comida, helados, papas, pero la mayoría se dedica a la confección de ropa como ser: blusas, pantalones y vestidos y otros. Estos artilculos son confeccionados por ellas mismas. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de telas importadas y equipos especiales, de esta manera poder expandir su negocio y lograr ofrecer sus productos de mayor calidad, fuera del país.

loans.use: Obtain capital to purchase imported fabrics and special equipment.

texts.es:
En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “señor de exaltacion”que cuenta con 16 socias.
Un grupo muy simpático ya que además de trabajar juntas con el sistema de créditos que Pro-Mujer les ofrece, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas.

Son varias las actividades que  realiza la asociación “, alguna de ellas tiene  una tienda de víveres, otras socias venden comida, helados, papas, pero la mayoría se dedica a la confección de ropa como ser: blusas, pantalones y vestidos y otros. Estos artilculos son confeccionados por ellas mismas.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de telas importadas y equipos especiales, de esta manera poder expandir su negocio y lograr ofrecer sus productos de mayor calidad, fuera del país.

loans.use: NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE MAQUINARIA ESPECIAL Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Señor De Exaltacion Group

texts.es:
En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “señor de exaltacion”que cuenta con 16 socias.
Un grupo muy simpático ya que además de trabajar juntas con el sistema de créditos que Pro-Mujer les ofrece, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas.

Son varias las actividades que  realiza la asociación “, alguna de ellas tiene  una tienda de víveres, otras socias venden comida, helados, papas, pero la mayoría se dedica a la confección de ropa como ser: blusas, pantalones y vestidos y otros. Estos artilculos son confeccionados por ellas mismas.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de telas importadas y equipos especiales, de esta manera poder expandir su negocio y lograr ofrecer sus productos de mayor calidad, fuera del país.

loans.use: NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE MAQUINARIA ESPECIAL Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Twelve women form the Tres Estrellas Association and have worked with Pro-Mujer for approximately 4 years. They are a very joyful group, and they are happy with the benefits that this center offers them. Eight of them are married and on average have about 4 children each, with the majority being less than 10 years of age. They each perform different activities such as selling prepared meals, running a café and making products woven with alpaca and offer them in the different markets of the city of La Paz. They would like to request bigger loans to inject capital into their businesses to obtain greater earnings for the well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

12 mujeres conforman la asociación “Tres Estrellas” que trabajan con Pro-Mujer hace 4 años aproximadamente, un grupo muy alegre y contento con los beneficios que el centro les brinda. 8 de ellas son casadas y tienen un promedio de cuatro hijos, en su mayoría menores a 10 años. Se dedican a diferentes actividades, como ser la venta de comida, cafetería, tejidos en alpaca productos que los ofrecen en los distintos mercado de la ciudad de La Paz. Ellas quieren tener mayores créditos para inyectar de capital a sus negocios de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias para el bien de sus niños

loans.use: Purchase capital to inject into their businesses.

loans.name: Antofagasta Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto lies the Villa Tejada Focus Center, to which the Antofagasta Association has been a part of for over 4 years and consists of 16 women anxious to prosper in their small businesses.

The majority of the group’s members are married and say they need to help their husbands with their household’s finances since each have an average of 4 children. Such is the case of Eugenia, who regretfully widowed and had to care for her family on her own and now needs greater earnings to persevere.

The chief activity in the group is sales. They sell chompas (ponchos) woven in wool, prepared meals, natural fruit juices, cosmetics and other items depending on the season, which they sell in the fair of the Tiahuanacu market in the city of El Alto. They need capital to increase their merchandise stock, and in that way generate greater income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Villa Tejada a éste pertenece, hace mas de 4 años la asociación “Antofagasta”, integradas por 16 mujeres ansiosas de progresar en sus pequeños negocios.

La mayoría en el grupo son casadas y afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus esposos en la economía del hogar, ya que tienen un promedio de 4 niños cada una, tal es el caso de doña Eugenia que lamentablemente quedo viuda y tubo que hacerse cargo de su familia ella sola por lo que necesita mayores recursos para. subsistir.

La actividad principal en la asociación es el comercio, venden chompas tejidas en lana, comida, jugos de fruta natural, cosméticos y otros dependiendo de la temporada. Productos que los ofrecen en la feria del mercado Tiahuanacu de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas precisan capital para incrementar su mercadería de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.

loans.use: Purchase more capital wholesale.

loans.name: Obreras Group

texts.es:
The Obreras Association has been part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than 5 years and has completed 8 loan cycles. It is situated in the Villa Tejada zone in the city of El Alto. To date, it has 18 members who have demonstrated to be an organized group in regard to the center’s work.

A large majority of them do not own a home, which leads them to pay monthly leases for small living areas that are not big enough for their numerous families. They face the necessity of saving money with the dream of owning their own home.

Crafts are the main activity of this group, producing furniture, shoes, ceramics, paints and other items. They need more capital to expand their workshops and buy larger amounts of prime material, and in this way increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación denominada “Obreras” pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace ya cinco años cumpliendo con 8 ciclos de crédito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Villa Tejada, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 18 socias que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto al trabajo del centro.

Una gran parte de ellas no cuenta con casa propia lo que les lleva a pagar alquileres mensuales de pequeños ambientes que no les son suficientes para sus numerosas familias Teniendo la necesidad de ahorrar dinero con el sueño de comprar una casita propia.

La artesanía es la actividad principal de este grupo, produciendo así, muebles, zapatos, cerámicas. pinturas, y otros. Necesitan de mayor capital para ampliar sus talleres y comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima de esta manera sus ganancias serian mayores.

loans.use: Obtain capital to expand their workshops and purchase larger amounts of prime material.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is very creative and her artistic sensitivity is expressed in the beautiful embroidery that she develops every day with her wonderful hands in the comfort of her own home, because she also wants to take care of her 4 children. Her beautiful handiwork has resulted in the increased popularity of her work in a short period of time. She plans in the near future to make embroidery at a company level with the growth of her small shop. For some time she has been working with this goal in mind and is asking for a loan through this venue to acquire a larger quantity of cloth and embroidery yarn so that she does not have to interrupt her daily tasks.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Adela es muy creativa y su sensibilidad artística se plasma en los bellos bordados que cada día desarrolla con sus manos maravillosas en la comodidad de su hogar porque desea también estar al pendiente de sus 4 hijos. Sus bellos acabados han hecho que en poco tiempo se popularice sus servicios, tiene en mente dentro de poco dedicarse a la elaboración de bordados a nivel empresarial con la consolidación de su pequeño taller y precisamente con el propósito de alcanzar este objetivo viene trabajando desde hace mucho y en a través de este portal solicita un préstamo de dinero a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de hilos y telas para no interrumpir su tarea diaria.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of embroidery yarn and cloth.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
After having spent many years of her life working as a street vendor, Marilu has recently established a small business selling general consumer products in a space in her home. The urgent needs of her developing children and her husband’s departure have injected her with much strength and fortitude to continue with her work. She wishes to increase the quantity of her products and make her store more popular, that is the reason for her request of a loan to grow her small space where she works every day.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Después de haber dedicado muchos años de su vida al comercio ambulatorio, Marilú se acaba de establecer con su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos de primera necesidad en un espacio de su hogar. La necesidad apremiante de sus hijos en pleno desarrollo y el abandono de su esposo le han inyectado mucha fuerza y entereza para continuar con su labor.Desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos y popularizar los servicios de su tienda, por ese motivo solicita un préstamo para consolidar su pequeño espacio de labor diaria.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve the offerings and products of her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Doña Maria is a sewing expert. Her abilities to combine wool fibers and produce beautiful garments make her products of excellent quality. She makes tablecloths, hats, and wool scarves, as well as crochet work. Her ability and curiosity have innovated models and produced exclusive designs. As part of her desire to better herself and improve, Doña Maria has received trainings about business ideas and exporting. Through this she has awakened her big goal of becoming an excellent exporter. She wants to obtain a loan to increase her capital and invest it in buying a bigger quantity of raw material to continue to make her beautiful garments.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Doña Maria es una virtuosa del tejido, sus habilidades para entrelazar fibras de lana y producir bellas prendas hacen que su productividad sea de excelente calidad, ella elabora tapetes, gorras y chalinas de lana tanto a crochet como a palito, su habilidad y curiosidad ha innovado los modelos y ha producido diseños exclusivos. En su afán de superación y mejoramiento continuo Doña Maria a recibido capacitaciones acerca de las ideas de negocio y exportación y con el ha despertado su gran anhelo de convertirse en una excelente exportadora.Desea obtener un préstamo a fin de incrementar el capital de su trabajo e invertirlo en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima a fin de seguir elaborando sus bellas prendas.

loans.use: Increase capital for work to acquire a greater quantity of primary material and to continue to make beautiful garments

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Zarita

texts.es:
Zarita possesses a lot of talent in making wool garments with knitting needles. She works daily within her home without ignoring the development of her small daughter; she always accompanies her and while she attends her daughter's daily classes, she tirelessly knits. She has the noble wish of forming a group of knitters with the goal of networking and making garments on a bigger scale and of a bigger variety. With this purpose in mind, she asks for your support to begin her road towards progress.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Zarita, posee mucho talento para elaborar prendas de lana con palitos de tejer, se desempeña a diario dentro de su hogar sin descuidar el desarrollo escolar de su pequeña; la acompaña siempre y mientras atienda la lectura diaria de su niña teje incansablemente.Tiene el noble deseo de constituir un grupo de tejedoras a fin de asociarse y elaborar prendas en mayor escala y de mayor variedad; con ese propósito en mente solicita vuestro apoyo para iniciar su camino hacia el progreso.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of primary material (wool)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lelia

texts.es:
Doña Lelia, in conjunction with her older children, has installed an auto body in her home to lend her services to the hundreds of motorists in the city. Besides the repair services that they offer in this small space, they also take all their tools to the place that requires their knowledge. Due to this, they have let their workshop go a bit and have decided together to agree to remain in this small space for a time to improve their area and to bring a greater character of a business to it.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Doña Lelia en sociedad con sus hijos mayores ha instalado en casa una vulcanizadora para prestar sus servicios a los centenares de conductores de su ciudad.Además de los servicios de reparación que brindan en este pequeño espacio se trasladan con todos sus implementos hasta el lugar en el que requieren de sus conocimientos, a causa de este hecho han descuidado un poco su taller y han decidido en común acuerdo mantenerse en este espacio por un pequeño espacio de tiempo para mejorar sus instalaciones y otorgarle mayor carácter empresarial.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to get more and better tools for her work space

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa has begun her work as a guina pig raiser as an experiment and with the desire of increasing the economic income of her beloved family. She has installed a breeding space similar to those that other families in the city established and has begun her work with a small number of guinea pigs. Those, in a small amount of time, due to excellent food and care, have reproduced very quickly and now have doubled in number. She has a desire to increase the space in order to proviD. them with more freedom and comfort so that they reach the weight and size desired by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Rosa, ha iniciado su labor D. criadora D. cuyes D. modo experimental y por la iniciativa y deseos D. incrementar los ingresos económicos D. su amada familia. Ha instalado un espacio D. crianza a semejanza D. las que establecieron otras familias D. su ciudad y ha iniciado su tarea con un número pequeño D. ejemplares. En poco tiempo estos debido a la excelente alimentación y cuidados se han reproducido muy rápido y ahora han duplicado su número, tiene deseos D. ampliar su espacio a fin D. otorgarles mayor libertad y comodidad para que alcancen el peso y tamaño deseado por sus clientes.

loans.use: Increasing her breeding space

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.en:
Karina, Ana, and Juana are members of the community bank “Los Sauces de Compañia”. “Los Sauces do Compañia has 28 members, all of whom are from the area of Compañia on the outskirts of the city. They joined the bank one and a half years ago and have now completed three loan cycles. Through the community bank they have learned how to manage money and be responsible.

All three women live with their partners. Karina is twenty and has a two-year-old son. Ana is 26 and has a four-year-old daughter and two year old son. Juana is 28 and has two sons who are eight and six.

Karina, Ana, and Juana are members of brick-0making families. For several generations their families have made and fired adobe bricks. However, all of them hope that their children will leave the trade. Their dreams are that their children will receive good educations and find work as professionals.

They need loans of 300, 1200, and 450 soles (2.8 soles = $1) respectively. They will invest their loans by purchasing things such as fore wood, charcoal, and paying employees.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making bricks

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosario's Group

texts.es:
Miriam, Mery y Rosario have belonged to the 30 de junio Banco Comunal for 6 years, 8 months and 2 years.

Miriam is married, is 30 years old and has 3 children. She sells meat house-to-house in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells blankets at different fairs throughout the region.

Mery lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 2 children. She sells breakfast walking through the Nery García market. Mery used to sell potatoes but stopped doing so because her son is young.

Rosario is separated, is 40 years old and has three children. She sells emoliente (a hot drink with healing properties) walking through the Nery García market.

Miriam, Mery and Rosario need loans of 600, 1000 and 300 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of meat, blankets, sugars, herbs and, in Mery's case, to pay for part of the land that she is going to buy.

Miriam, Mery and Rosario's dreams to have money in the future, their own homes and improves their businesses and for their children to become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Miriam, Mery y Rosario pertenecen al Banco Comunal 30 de junio hace 6 años, 8 meses, 2 años.

Miriam es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Miriam vende carne de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Miriam vende mantas en las diferentes ferias de la región.

Por otro lado Mery es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Mery vende desayuno en el mercado Nery García de manera ambulatoria. Anteriormente Mery vendía tubérculos actividad que dejo de realizar porque su hijo es pequeño.

Mientras que Rosario es separada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Rosario vende emoliente (bebida caliente con propiedades curativas) de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García.

Miriam, Mery y Rosario necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, 300 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne, mantas, azúcar, hierbas y en el caso de Mery es para pagar una parte del terreno que comprará.

Los sueños de Miriam, Mery y Rosario son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener dinero en el futuro, casa propia y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Miriam, Mery y Rosario need loans of 600, 1000 and 300 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of meat, blankets, sugar, herbs and,  in Mery's case to pay for part of the land that she is going to buy.

loans.name: Benita's Group

texts.es:
Benita, Marcelina y Celestina have belonged to the Yanapanakusun Banco Comunal, which means "let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 10, 1 and 12 years respectively.

Benita is separated, is 41 years old and has 4 children. She sells food in a rented stall on the puente nuevo. Benita also has a small grocery store in her house that is run by her daughter.

Marcelina lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 3 children. She sells candy, cakes and chicha (corn whiskey) while walking along the Avenida Javier Pérez.

Celestina is married, is 57 years old and has 6 children. Celestina and her husband have a carpentry shop in their house.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina need loans of 600, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soap, detergent, oil, cookies, soft drinks and wood.

Benita, Marcelina and Celestina's dreams are to improve their businesses, for their children to become working professionals, and to have stable business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa “Ayudémonos” en quechua, hace 10, 1, 12 años respectivamente.

Benita es separada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Benita venD. comida en un local alquilado en el puente nuevo. Además Benita tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa que esta administrado por su hija.

Por otro lado Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina venD. golosinas, pasteles y chicha D. manera ambulatoria en la Av. Javier Pérez.

Mientras que Celestina es casada, tiene 57 años y 6 hijos, Celestina junto a su esposo tienen un taller D. carpintería en su casa.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina necesitan un préstamo D. 600 soles, 450 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, jabón, detergente, aceite, galletas, gaseosas y maderas.

Los sueños D. Benita, Marcelina y Celestina son mejorar sus negocios, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un negocio estable.

loans.use: Benita, Marcelina y Celestina need loans of 600, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soap, detergent, oil, cookies, soft drinks and wood.

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
Nemecia works all day, every day, in a small space outside her home which she established with the goal of selling vegetables in the morning and sandwiches in the evening. With the income that she receives daily from her work, she can fully maintain her beloved children. She wishes to increase her capital in order to make a greater quantity of meals and to make her facilities more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Nemecia, labora todo el día y todos los días en un pequeño espacio fuera de su hogar que estableció con el propósito de comercializar vegetales por las mañanas y diversos bocadillos por las tardes. Con el ingreso que percibe a diario por su labor puede mantener plenamente a sus queridos hijos.Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para elaborar mayor cantidad de alimentos y para hacer más cómoda sus instalaciones de servicio.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her products and service.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Leoncia's Group

texts.es:
Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen have belonged to the Yanapanakusun Banco Comunal, which means "Let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 3, 5, and 3 years respectively.

Benjamina is a single mother, is 55 years old and has one daughter. She makes desserts and mazamorra (cornmeal porridge) and sells them in her daughter's restaurant.

Leoncia lives with her partner, is 45 years old and has 4 daughters. She sells children's clothing, backpacks and sombreros and depending on the location she sells in different fairs in the region and sometimes in some locations in the city.

Carmen lives with her partner, is 42 years old and has 3 children. She has a small business organizing events. She provides services such as decoration, the preparation of food, cakes and other services.

Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen need loans of 450, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar, and eggs for making cakes, and backpacks, fabric and acrylics.

Benjamina, Leoncia and Carmen's dreams are for their family to be healthy and understanding, for their children to become professionals, to have their own home and for their stores to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa “Ayudémonos” en quechua, hace 3, 5, 3 años respectivamente.

Benjamina es madre soltera, tiene 55 años y 1 hija, Benjamina hace postres, mazamorras y lo vende en el restaurante de su hija.

Por otro lado Leoncia es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 4 hijas, Leoncia vende ropa de niños, mochilas, sombreros dependiendo de la campaña, sus ventas lo realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región y algunas veces alquila puestos en la ciudad.

Mientras que Carmen es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Carmen tiene una pequeña empresa organizadora de eventos que brinda servicios de decoración de locales, elaboración de comida, tortas, entre otros servicios.

Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen necesitan préstamos de 450 soles, 450 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar, huevo, mochilas, telas y acrílicos para tortas.

Los sueños de Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen son que su familia tengan buena salud y comprensión, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia y una tienda bien implementada.

loans.use: Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen need loans of 450, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar, and eggs for making cakes, and backpacks, fabric and acrylics.

loans.name: Susi

texts.es:
Susi is a hard-working woman. Thanks to her efforts and dedication her beloved family has been able to overcome painful moments of financial scarcity through her sales of cosmetics. Her performance over three years has been notable and she has a wide range of clients and friends who month over month request her products. She has in mind the goal to set up shop in a commercial center from which she may offer her beauty services and products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Susi, es una mujer muy trabajadora, gracias a su empeño y dedicación su amada familia ha podido superar penosos momentos de escasez económica, con la venta de cosméticos.Su desempeño durante tres años ha sido notable y cuenta con una gran gama de clientes y amistades que mes a mes solicitan sus productos, tiene en mente instalarse en un centro comercial para desde este lugar brindar sus servicios de asesoramiento y venta de productos de belleza.

loans.use: More capital in order to offer a greater quantity of products so that she may establish herself in a space in the busier commercial center of her city.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Juana Carmen's Group

texts.es:
Briggett, Rosa y Juana have belonged to the Banco Comunal of Yanapanakusun, which means "let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 1, 1 and 4 years respectively.

Briggett is a single mother, is 20 years old and have one son who is a systems engineering student. Briggett has a store where she sells clothing, groceries, and toys. She buys some of her products in the city of Lima.

Rosa lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Rosa and her husband make corn canchas (toasted snacks made from grains) , wheat, and noodles, which they sell wholesale out of their house.

Juana is married, is 53 years old and has 2 children. Juana sells underwear to friends and acquaintances. She also works in a social aid institution.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana need loans of 1000, 600 and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of shirts, pants, shoes, noodles, corn, wheat and underwear.

Briggett, Rosa and Juana's dreams are to have a store in the city center, to travel abroad, to provide their children with a good education and to have a house in the city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa “Ayudémonos” en quechua, hace 1 año, 4 meses, 1 año respectivamente.

Briggett es madre soltera, tiene 20 años y 1 hijo, estudiante de Ingeniería de Sistemas, Briggett tiene una bodega donde vende ropa, abarrotes, juguetes, algunos de sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Por otro lado Rosa es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo elabora canchas (bocaditos hechos de cereales que son tostados) de maíz, trigo, fideo y sus ventas lo realizan en su casa al por mayor.

Mientras que Juana es casada, tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Juana vende ropas interiores, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además trabaja en una institución como asistenta social.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones, zapatos, fideo, maíz, trigo y ropas interiores.

Los sueños de Briggett, Rosa y Juana son tener su tienda en el centro de la ciudad, viajar al extranjero, brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una casa en la ciudad de Lima.

loans.use: Briggett, Rosa y Juana need loans of 1000, 600 and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of shirts, pants, shoes, noodles, corn, wheat and underwear.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is a woman who is very committed to the development of her home. On a daily basis, she dedicates herself to providing service from her shop in addition to working as the municipal councilor of her community. Her knowledge and good management have been the contributing factors to her becoming a female leader in her community. She works with her family in the countrysiD. and also tends to her cows in her stable. She wishes to proviD. better service in her store and acquire a greater quantity of products for the benefit of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Bertha, es una mujer muy comprometida con el desarrollo D. su espacio habitacional y familiar, se dedica a diario a brindar servicios en su tienda y también a desempeñar el cargo D. regidora en su comunidad. Sus conocimientos y buena administración han sido factores preponderantes para convertirse en una mujer líder D. su localidad.Trabaja con su familia en el campo y también atienD. a sus vaquitas en su establo. Desea brindar un mejor servicio en su bodega y adquirir mayor cantidad D. productos para beneficio D. sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremental capital to acquire a greater quantity of raw materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a hard-working mother dedicated to her family. She works alongside her husband on farmland sowing corn, potatoes, and barley in order to support her beloved children. She has the aim of working more enthusiastically at harvest time and, with the next planting, gradually improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una madre muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Se desempeña en compañía de su esposo en sus tierras agrícolas sembrando maíz, papa y cebada para el sostén de sus queridos hijos.Tiene el propósito de laborar con mayor ahínco en la cosecha y próxima siembra con el objetivo de mejorar paulatinamente la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase natural fertilizers.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Yolanda, Nely and Victoria are members of the Kutimuy Community Bank, which means "Come Back" in Quechua.

Yolanda is 28 years old and has 4 children. With her husband, she bakes bread. Her sales are maD. in fair and are also sold in bulk at kiosks.

Nely is married. She is 32 years old and has 2 children. Nely and her husband are artisans who make rugs and belts, which they sell at the market in Santa Clara. Nely also travels to fairs once a month, where she purchases cheese which she then sells door to door.

Victoria is married. She is 63 years old and has 6 children. Victoria makes cloth products like small blankets, which she sells at the market in Santa Clara.

Yolanda, Nely and Victoria need loans of 400 soles each, money which will be invested in the purchase of flour, sesame, wool, thread and dye.

Yolanda, Nely and Victoria dream of improving their businesses, having their children become professionals and having a factory of cloth products with many employees.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda, Nely y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa “Regresa” en quechua.

Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 4 hijos, Yolanda junto a su esposo panifican panes en un horno alquilado, sus ventas lo realizan en ferias y también reparten a kioscos por mayor.

Por otro lado Nely es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Nely junto a su esposo realizan artesanía en telar como tapices, cinturones que venden en el mercado Santa Clara. Además Nely viaja a las ferias una vez por mes donD. compra quesos y lo venD. D. casa en casa.

Mientras que Victoria es casada, tiene 63 años y 6 hijos, Victoria realiza trabajos en telar como frazadas y lo venD. en el mercado Santa Clara.

Yolanda, Nely y Victoria necesitan préstamos D. 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina, ajonjolí, lana, hilo, tinte.

Los sueños D. Yolanda, Nely y Victoria son mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una empresa D. artesanía textil con muchos trabajadores.

loans.use: Purchasing flour, sesame, wool, thread and dye

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
Don Cupertino is a hard-working and loving father. Since his wife decided to leave him along with his two dear children, he has worked hard to provide them the basics so that they can develop fully. In a small shop in his home, he makes spoons and ladles of wood and then, when he finishes his weekly work, he goes to the markets in his city in order to sell his products at reasonable prices. He gets a great reception and, thanks to the income that he generates, his work covers the education expenses of his beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Don Cupertino es un padre muy trabajador y amoroso, desde que su esposa decidió abandonarlo junto a sus dos queridos hijos se ha esforzado para brindarles lo necesario a fin de que estos puedan desarrollarse plenamente. En un pequeño taller de su hogar elabora cucharas y cucharones de madera y luego de concluir su labor semanal se desplaza a las ferias de su ciudad para ofertar sus productos a precios muy módicos, tiene gran acogida y gracias a las ganacias que le genera su labor satisface los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: More capital to acquire new tools and a greater quantity of raw materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Perseverance and diligent work helps Edilberto to excel and be one of the best livestock farmers in his area. Every day, he is focused on the development and feeding of his beloved cattle. In the mornings, with much delicacy, he milks the cows. His wife in is charge of distributing the milk to his customers who make cheeses and pastries in their community. He also offers meat and sometimes sells in the livestock markets in his city. He has a great desire to increase the number of animals in his stable and improve the conditions of his livestock supply in order to obtain exceptional development.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La perseverancia y trabajo diligente ayudan a Edilberto a sobresalir y a ser uno de los mejores ganaderos de su zona. Todos los días está pendiente del desarrollo de sus queridas vaquitas y de su alimentación, con mucha delicadeza por las mañanas saca la leche que su querida esposa se encarga de repartir a sus clientes para la elaboración de quesos y postres dentro de su comunidad; también oferta su carne y en algunas oportunidades las vende en las ferias ganaderas de su ciudad.Tiene mucho deseo de incrementar el número de los animalitos en su establo y mejorar las condiciones de su alimentación a fin de que obtengan un desarrollo excepcional.

loans.use: Capital to improve the conditions of his livestock supply and increase their number.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Viviana's Group

texts.es:
Gloria, Justina and Vivana have been partners of the Kutimuy Community Bank, which means "Come Back" in Quechua, for 12, 3 and 10 years respectively.

Gloria is 32 years old and has 3 children. She is an artisan who creates beautiful products on the loom, an activity that she does along with her husband and children. She also has a small general store in her home.

Justina is married. She is 38 years old and has 3 children. Justina and her family create cloth products like bags that are sold in a factory where Justina works as an embroiderer.

Viviana is a single mother. She is 42 years old and has 1 child. She travels to fairs in the region where she sells vegetables and fish. Vivana also sells small animals in the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Gloria, Justina and Viviana need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles and 600 soles respective, money that will be invested in the purchasing of thread, dye, straw hats and fish.

Gloria, Justina and Viviana dream of having their own homes and businesses. They also want to provide their children with a good education and provide their products to the provinces.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria, Justina y Viviana son socias del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa “Regresa” en quechua hace 12, 3, 10 años respectivamente.

Gloria es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Gloria es artesana, realiza bellos trabajos en telar como individuales, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo e hijos. Además Gloria tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Justina es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Justina junto a su familia realizan trabajos en telar como bolsos que son vendidos a una empresa donde Justina trabaja bordando.

Mientras que Viviana es madre soltera, tiene 42 años y 1 hijo, Viviana viaja a las ferias de la región donde vende verduras y pescado. Además Viviana se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Gloria, Justina y Viviana necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos, tintes, pavitas y pescado.

Los sueños de Gloria, Justina y Viviana son tener casa propia, un negocio propio, sus hijos tengan una buena educación y proveer directamente sus productos a provincias.

loans.use: Purchasing of thread, dye, and fish

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy is a hard-working and dedicated woman. Her wishes to offer exclusive knitwear and to dress the beautiful mothers of her city well led her to establish a small shop for selling clothing and footwear where she personally accessorizes each person who visits her each day. Thanks to her efforts and good taste her gains and wishes have not been made to wait. She now plans to expand and start a chain of stores with the name that gained popularity in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Lucy, es una mujer muy laboriosa y dedicada, sus deseos por ofrecer prendas exclusivas y vestir bien a las bellas madres de familia de su ciudad la condujeron a instalar un pequeño espacio de ventas de prendas de vestir y calzado en el que asesora personalmente a cada una de las personas que la visitan a diario.Gracias a su desempeño y buen gusto las ganacias y deseos de mejorar no se han hecho esperar y ahora tiene planeado expandirse y constituir una cadena de tiendas con el nombre que le dio popularidad dentro de su comunidad.

loans.use: Capital to start her entrepreneurial dream.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is an excellent teacher of traditional dance and a loving mother; with the help of her husband she works not only to share her knowledge of dance with young students of the city, but also in selling a variety of household articles in various markets. These jobs have helped her to ensure the well-being of her children, but in her heart is the hope of creating a small school of traditional dance to pass on the artistic legacy of her ancestors to the youth of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

Consuelo es una excelente maestra de danzas típicas y un amorosa madre; con ayuda de su querido esposo se dedica además de impartir sus conocimientos a los jóvenes estudiantes de su ciudad a ofertar los días de feria diversos artículos de uso doméstico en los diferentes lugares de concentración popular.Estas actividades le han otorgado bienestar a sus queridas pequeñas, pero acogen en sus corazones el deseo de instalar en casa una pequeña escuela de danzas típicas para interiorización del legado artístico de sus antepasados a las generaciones jóvenes de su ciudad.

loans.use: Capital to install a school of traditional dance in her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Cristina's Group

texts.es:
Maribel, Cristina, and Dina have belonged to the Communal Bank “Paloma” for 1 year, 8 months, and 8 months, respectively.

Maribel has a live-in partner, she is 24 years old and has one daughter. Maribel sells clothes on credit to family and friends. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. She also sells food on some occasions.

Cristina is single and is 24 years old. She has a store where she sells meat, groceries, and vegetables. On some occasions she sells cosmetics through a catalog.

Dina also has a live-in partner, she is 37 years old and has 3 children. She sells food in a bus terminal. With the loan that she will obtain, Dina will buy a refrigerator.

Maribel, Cristina and Dina need loans of 600 soles ($230 US), 800 soles ($300 US), and 1000 soles ($370 US), money that will be invested in the purchase of jerseys, jackets, rice, sugar, milk, eggs, plates, spoons, and for the down payment on a refrigerator.

The dreams of Maribel, Cristina and Dina are to have stable businesses, to finish their higher education, and to open additional branches and other businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kaleigh Ruffner, Breanna Wong and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Maribel, Cristina y Dina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Paloma hace 1 año, 8 meses, 8 meses respectivamente.

Maribel es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Maribel vende ropa a crédito a familiares y amigos, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima. Además Maribel en algunas ocasiones vende comida.

Por otro lado Cristina es soltera y tiene 24 años, Cristina tiene una bodega donde vende carne, abarrotes, verduras. En algunas ocasiones Cristina vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Dina es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Dina vende comida en un puesto del terminal terrestre. Dina con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará su refrigeradora.

Maribel, Cristina y Dina necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 800 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, casacas, arroz, azúcar, leche, huevo, platos, cucharas y para la inicial de una refrigeradora.

Los sueños de Maribel, Cristina y Dina son tener un negocios estable, terminar sus estudios superiores, tener otra sucursal y otro negocio más.

loans.use: Maribel, Cristina and Dina need loans of 600 soles ($230 US), 800 soles ($300 US), and 1000 soles ($370 US), money that will be invested in the purchase of jerseys, jackets, rice, sugar, milk, eggs, plates, spoons, and for the down payment on a refrigerator.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina has been selling brand-name cosmetics which are popular in her country for a long time now. She has decided to take up this work after observing the economic struggle of her family during periods of absence of her husband, who makes a living as a musician, touring throughout the country with his band. Her involvement in this business has been very positive, and her knowledge of beauty products has increased. Now Georgina is hoping for a loan of $300 to increase her investment capital in order to offer a greater quantity of products, and also offer cosmetic advice out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Georgina, desD. hace mucho se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. las marcas más reconocidas D. su país; decidió llevar a esta labor al observar la escasez económica D. su familia durante los períodos D. ausencia artística D. su querido esposo, ya que se dedica a llevar alegría con su grupo D. música a los diferente pueblos D. su país.Su incursión en este negocio a sido muy positiva y han incrementado sus conocimientos D. belleza, ahora tiene el propósito D. incrementar su capital D. inversión para ofertar mayor cantidad D. productos y también para brindar asesoría cosmética en la comodidad D. su hogar.

loans.use: Capital for increasing the supply of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Diudora

texts.es:
Diudora has been a member of the Communal Bank “Legion” for the past 8 years.

She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Diudora has a replacement auto-parts store on Arenales Avenue, and her husband owns a repair shop for cars.

In addition, Diudora has a transportation business that runs from the communities of the District of Acosvinchos, and she has three cars that run this route. Diudora plans to develop an interprovincial transportation business.

Diudora needs a loan of 3000 soles (approx. $1125 US) which she will invest in the purchase of headlights, starters, and alternators that will be brought from the city of Lima.

Diudora’s dreams are for her children to become professionals, to have a larger store, to have an interprovincial transportation business, and to own her own home in the city of Ayacucho and Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Diudora es socia del Banco Comunal Legión hace 8 años.

Diudora es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Diudora tiene una tienda de repuestos para carros en la Av. Arenales y su esposo tiene un taller de reparaciones para carros.

Además Diudora tiene una empresa de transportes que viaja a las comunidades del Distrito de Acosvinchos y tiene 3 carros. Diudora tiene proyectado formar una empresa de transportes interprovincial.

Diudora necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de focos, arrancadores, alternadores que serán traídos de la ciudad de Lima.

Los sueños de Diudora son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una tienda más grande, una empresa de transporte interprovincial, casa propia en la ciudad de Ayacucho y Lima.

loans.use: Diudora needs a loan of 3000 soles (approx. $1125 US) which she will invest in the purchase of headlights, starters, and alternators that will be brought from the city of Lima.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 43762

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina Gonzales is considered a hard working, honest, understanding woman and a good mother. She is married to Mr. Teodulo Rivera San Roman who is a general assistant to a carpenter. They have three children; Eliud Geovane is single and 22 years old, Kelia is 15 years old and a high school student, and Sara Janai is 8 years old and is in primary school. They all live at home.

She started her business to be able to move ahead and help her son finish school and also help her husband with the expenses of the home and satisfy her personal needs. She started out 15 years ago selling fabric that one her brothers would send to her from the city of San Luis Potosi. Later, a friend invited her to sell cosmetic products; this was in May of 1998. She started selling these products to her existing customers, neighbors and family members. With this income she was able to help her son finish high school.

She is now requesting a loan of USD $300 which she will repay in 4 months to supply the orders that her customers place and have a larger variety to offer to her prospective customers. With your support Bernardina will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Bernardina González se considera una persona muy trabajadora, honesta, comprensiva y buena madre. Esta casada con el Sr. Teódulo Rivera San Román quien es ayudante general de Carpintero, tienen 3 hijos Eliud Geovane de 22 años, soltero; Keila de 15 años, estudiante de secundaria y Sara Janaí de 8 años estudiante de primaria; todos viven en casa.

Inició el negocio por deseos de salir adelante y lograr que su hijo terminara la secundaria así como poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y poder satisfacer sus necesidades personales. Emprendió hace 15 años vendiendo tela que un hermano le enviaba desde la ciudad de San Luis Potosí, posteriormente una amiga la invitó a vender productos cosmeticos, esto fue en mayo de 1998, comenzó ofreciendo estos productos a los clientes que ya tenía, vecinas y familiares, con este ingreso logro que su hijo terminara la secundaria.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir los pedidos que le hacen los clientes y para tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a los posibles compradores. Con tu apoyo Bernardina saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina has belonged to the Communal Bank of Love and Truth for five years.

Karina is 24 years old and lives with her partner and her two sons. She sells clothes in a store in the “12th of April” Market, and she acquires her merchandise in Lima. Besides this, she sells “chicha” (a corn-based liquor) and ice creams typical of the area called “Muyuchi” (made of sesame, milk, sugar and ice.) She carries out her sales in the main park of Ayacucho and also in the Santa Clara market.

Karina needs a loan of 2000 soles ($750 US) that she will invest in the purchase of jerseys, jeans, lingerie, robes and diapers.

Karina dreams of having a large car for city transportation, her own house, and that her sons will be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Gladfelter, Alex Christoff and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Karina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad hace 5 años.

Karina es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Karina vende ropa de bebe en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril, su mercadería es adquirida en la ciudad de Lima. Además Karina vende chicha y helados típico de la zona llamado “Muyuchi” (elaborado en base a ajonjolí, leche, azúcar, hielo) sus ventas lo realiza en el parque principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también en el mercado Santa Clara.

Karina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, jeans, ajuares, ropones, pañales.

Los sueños de Karina son tener un carro grande para transporte urbano, casa propia y sus hijos sean buenas personas.

loans.use: Karina needs a loan of 2000 soles ($750 US) that she will invest in the purchase of jerseys, jeans, lingerie, robes and diapers.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 43764

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina has belonged to the Communal Bank of Love and Truth for ten years.

She is a 48-year-old single mother with one daughter. She travels to different fairs in the region two times per week where she sells groceries, fruit, and breads. She buys cheese at the fair that she then resells in the F. Vivanco Market.

Justina needs a loan of 2500 soles ($925 US) that she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, noodles, flour, cookies, breads and various fruits.

Justina’s dreams are for her daughter to become a good professional, to make progress with the business, and to have a permanent store in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Gladfelter, Alex Christoff and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad hace 10 años.

Justina es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 1 hija, Justina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región dos veces por semana, donde vende abarrotes, frutas, panes y de las ferias trae queso que vende en el mercado F. Vivanco.

Justina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, harina, galletas, panes y frutas variadas.

Los sueños de Justina son que su hija sea buena profesional, progresar con su negocio y tener una tienda estable en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

loans.use: Justina needs a loan of 2500 soles ($925 US) that she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, noodles, flour, cookies, breads and various fruits.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina considers herself a loving, friendly and very hard-working person. She is married to Francisco Rodríguez Peralta who works as a security guard at a local restaurant. They have three children: Alondra Soley, aged 12, and a secondary student; Liliana Itzel aged 10 and at primary school and Anahi, aged 2.

She started her business because there was a time in which her husband was unable to find work and they had a lot of expenses, so that she put herself to work in any and every area, including cleaning houses. Later on their situation improved when her husband found a good job and they were even able to obtain a small social-interest house, which motivate her even more to establish a business in order to be able to cover all the household expenses.

Beginning in May 2004, as the woman she used to work for already used to give her used clothes in good condition which she would sell to her neighbours, she saw that it would be a good idea to begin to sell in the walking markets in nearby neighbourhoods. So she investigated where you could buy clothing in bulk and a neighbour contacted her with the name of someone in the town of Reynosa. This contact sends clothing packs to her when she needs stock.

Delfina is asking for a loan of $300 USD, which she will repay in 4 months in order to buy more clothes that she will be able to sell in the local markets and in this way increase her income.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Delfina se considera una persona amable, amigable y muy trabajadora. Está casada con el Sr. Francisco Rodríguez Peralta quien se desempeña como vigilante en un Restaurante de la localidad. Tienen 3 hijos Alondra Suley de 12 años, estudiante de Secundaria; Liliana Itzel de 10 años, estudiante de primaria y Anahí de 2 años.

Inició el negocio porque hubo una temporada en la cual su esposo no encontraba trabajo y tenían muchos gastos, fue por eso que se puso a trabajar en cualquier cosa, inclusive haciendo la limpieza en casas, pero después su situación mejoró cuando su esposo encontró un buen trabajo y hasta pudieron obtener una casita de interés social, razón que la motivó mas aún a poner su negocio para poder cubrir todos los gastos. Además deseaba obtener un ingreso extra para no depender totalmente de lo que le daba su esposo, y le gustan mucho las ventas por lo que empezó a vender ropa y zapatos de temporada.

Comenzó en Mayo de 2004, ya que la señora con la que trabajaba le regalaba ropa usada en buenas condiciones la cual vendía con vecinas de la colonia, y como vio que le iba bien empezó a ir a los mercados ambulantes de colonias cercanas a su casa y se puso a investigar donde podía comprar “pacas” de ropa y una vecina la contactó con una persona en la ciudad de Reynosa. Esta persona le envía las pacas cada vez que necesita.

Solicita un crédito por US $ 300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más ropa que pueda vender en los mercados de la localidad y de esta manera aumentar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Love and Truth” for 10 years.

Juana is 47 years old. She is married with 9 children, and 5 of them live with her. Juana travels to different fairs in the region three times a week to buy pigs and sheep, which she then raises for butchering. Later, she sells the meat at wholesale in the Santa Clara market and she also sells it from house to house.

Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $737.00 US). This money will be invested in the purchase of cattle, goats, and pigs.
