Cuando su esposo la abandono ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar una forma de mantener a sus hijos, sobretodo poder darles educacion. Hace 6 años inicio vendiendo refrescos y tortas a los transportistas que pasaban por esta carretera y se entero por ellos mismos de la necesidad que tenían ellos de bañarse, lavar y planchar su ropa, por lo que ella decidió ofrecerles sus servicios. Ahora también quiere comprara ropa usada para venderla a sus clientes.

Para ello solicita un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara la ropa usada y venderla. Con tu ayuda esta mujer emprendedora podrá seguir progresando.

loans.use: Buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto is divorced and has 2 children, 25 and 22. He started his business when he decided to leave the state of Guerrero for Queretaro. Three years ago, he realized that he could set up a seafood business, something common in his hometown and a business he knew very well. From his trailer, he makes a living selling seafood, offering his products in various cities.

Alberto is now applying for a US$250 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, he will be able to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

José Alberto es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 22 años. Inicio su negocio cuando decidió dejar el estado de Guerrero para irse a vivir a Querétaro, hace 3 años entonces se dio cuenta que podía poner un negocio de mariscos que es común en su ciudad natal, por lo que el conocía perfecto del tema, en su remolque se dedico a venderlos ofreciéndolos en diversas ciudades.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercancía. Con tu apoyo don Alberto saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is married and has 3 children, 16, 13 and 7. She started her business because her husband's income wasn't stretching far enough to cover the family's expenses. She has always enjoyed sales because she looks at it as an opportunity to do something that helps to add to the family's income. She started, 8 years ago, selling cold drinks, fried foods and snacks to her neighbors. Little by little, she built a store where she now sells groceries, fresh fruits and vegetables.

Maribel is applying for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, Maribel will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16,13 y 7 años. Inicio su negocio porque con el sueldo de su marido no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares. A ella siempre le han gustado las ventas por lo que vio una oportunidad para hacer algo relacionado que le ayudara a complementar los ingresos familiares. Hace 8 años empezó vendiendo refrescos, frituras y golosinas entre sus vecinos. Y poco a poco formo una tienda donde ahora vende abarrotes, frutas y verduras.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercancía. Con tu ayuda Maribel hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin is married and has two children, 7 and 3. He started the business because he needed an extra income to pay for operations that his children, both of whom were born with heart problems, had to have. His income before didn't cover all their expenses and his wife couldn't work because she had to care for the young patients. Though the kids are better today, they still need medical care. The business started 6 years ago with the sale of used clothes brought from the United States. Martin later expanded the business, adding new clothes, accessories, gifts, etc., which now generate larger revenues.

Martin is applying for a US$950 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to stock the business. With your help, Martin can continue his business and his children can continue to receive the medical treatment they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Martin E. es casado y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años. Inició el negocio Por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso extra, ya que sus dos hijos nacieron con problemas en el corazón, y requerían de varias operaciones, y con lo que el ganaba no le alcanzaba, además su esposa no podía apoyar al gasto familiar ya que cuidaba a los dos menores enfermos, hoy en día aunque están mejor aun reciben atención medica. El negocio comenzó hace 6 años con la venta de ropa usada que traía de Estados Unidos. Posteriormente fue incrementando su negocio con la venta de ropa nueva, accesorios, regalos, etc. Y actualmente esto le genera mejores ingresos.

Solicita un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para mantener surtido y estable el negocio. Con tu ayuda Martin seguirá con su negocio y sus hijos no suspenderán el tratamiento medico.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
“I have tried to improve my home but, in fact, the financial situation is very difficult. I would like to build two fences in the patio. The houses in the projects where I live are publicly subsidized and the space is very limited. As you can see in the picture, there is little privacy as they are built one right next to the other. I am requesting $800 to build the fences in the backyard of my house.”

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“He tratado de hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda, pero en realidad la situación económica esta muy difícil. Me gustaría levantar dos bardas en el patio, ya que las casas del fraccionamiento en donde vivo son de interés social, el espacio es muy reducido y, como pueden ver en la foto, tienen muy poca privacidad, ya que están construidas muy pegadas. Solicito 800 dólares para levantar dos bardas en el patio de mi vivienda.”

loans.use: Build fences in the backyard of my house.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
“Some months ago I finished the construction of a room in my home. Now I only need to plaster the walls and install tile flooring. I have worked hard to be able to build this room, but my savings are gone and I don’t have the capital needed to finish the construction. For this reason, I am requesting $1000 for the plastering and flooring.”

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace algunos meses terminé la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda. Ahora solo me falta enjarrar las paredes y poner vitropiso. He trabajado mucho para poder hacer este cuarto, pero mis ahorros ya se terminaron y no tengo capital para terminar la construcción. Por eso solicito 1,000 dólares para enjarrar las paredes y poner vitropiso en un cuarto de mi vivienda.”

loans.use: Wall plastering and flooring of a room.

loans.name: Percibal

texts.es:
“In the projects where I live the houses are publicly subsidized. If you can tell by the picture, houses are built one right next to the other, only separated by an exterior hallway. I would like to build fences to make my house safer, as presently it can be easily broken into, and I don’t want to expose my family. I am requesting $400 to build the fences.”

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“En el fraccionamiento donde vivo las casas son de interés social. Si se dan cuenta por la foto, las casas están pegadas una con la otra y solo las divide un pasillo. Me gustaría levantar las bardas para darle más seguridad a mi vivienda, ya que por cualquier parte se pueden meter y no quiero exponer a mi familia. Solicito 400 dólares para levantar las bardas del patio de mi vivienda.”

loans.use: Build a fence in the backyard of my house.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Ever since moving to her current home and since her only child started school, Modesta has felt it was time to find an activity to fill her spare time. It was important that she found something which meant she was rarely far away from her house, so that she could look after her home and child in the afternoons. With the aim of improving her economic situation, Modesta decided to open a small shop. Today, four years down the line, it is a grocery store. She is proud to see how her business has grown, since when she started she had nothing. In time, she wants to extend her premises and offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Desde que se mudo a su actual vivienda y desde que su único hijo, en ese entonces de cinco años, ingreso al colegio, Modesta creyó necesario ocuparse en una actividad en sus tiempos libres. Una actividad que no la alejara tampoco de su casa pues aun tenía que ocuparse de su hogar y de su hijo por las tardes. Con la idea de progresar y mejorar su situación económica, Modesta se animo a brir una pequeña tienda. Hoy en día ya lleva cuatro años en su bodega. Ella cuenta sentirse orgullosa al ver cómo ha crecido su negocio, ya que cuando empezó no tenía casi nada. En un tiempo, ella quisiera ampliar su local e implementarlo con otro rubro de productos.

loans.use: She wishes to offer beauty products in her store

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina is a hard-working woman and since the age of 18 she has worked in a ceramics workshop. Helping her husband and her brother-in-law, she started to learn about the ceramic trade, learning how to create different decorative ornaments. In time, she became an expert; nevertheless, keeping up a job and running a household was very hard for her. This is why she left her job to open a business from home. She realised that she could make a success of selling office and school equipment and so that is what she did. Today, she has been running her bookshop for three years and thankfully it is all going well. In the future she would like to install a mini ceramic workshop so that she can continue to create ornaments and so that her children have a secure business when they finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Constantina es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde los dieciocho años ha trabajado en un taller de cerámica. Ayudando a su esposo y a su cuñado empezó a aprender el oficio de trabajar la cerámica para producir diversos objetos de ornamento. Con el paso del tiempo ha llegado a especializarse en este oficio; no obstante, mantenerse en ese trabajo y a la vez ocuparse de los quehaceres del hogar fue muy pesado para ella. Es así que detuvo su trabajo para abrir un negocio en su misma casa. Se le ocurrió que tendría éxito vendiendo útiles para oficina y colegio si es que se lo proponía. Y así lo hizo. Actualmente lleva tres años con su librería y felizmente le está yendo bien. Más adelante ella quisiera implementar un mini taller de cerámica para seguir produciendo adornos y también para que sus hijos, al terminar el colegio, tengan un oficio seguro.

loans.use: To buy the necessary tools for her ceramic workshop

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
One of Esther’s friends encouraged her to invest in a business selling beauty products. To decided to go ahead, because at that time there were problems at home and she was looking for new ways to generate income. For a while she had been cleaning houses, washing clothes and kitchens of her various customers. Today, she only does this for short periods, one or two days, or on the weekends. Everything she earns goes towards her five children; since despite the fact that her husband also works as a driver, they often need more income. This is why, until she finds a more stable job she is going to continue to put all her efforts into developing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Una amiga de Esther la animó a invertir en el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Ella decidió aceptar, porque en aquel momento pasaba por algunos problemas en su casa y buscaba otras formas de generar ingresos al hogar. Muy aparte, desde hace un tiempo ella ofrece servicios de limpieza a casas, de lavado de ropa y de cocina a diversos clientes. Actualmente, solo lo hace por temporadas pequeñas, un día dos días o los fines de semana. Las ganancias que ella obtiene de su arduo trabajo van dirigidas a sus cinco hijos; ya que, a pesar, de que su esposo también trabaja siendo chofer, muchas veces se necesita más de un ingreso en la familia; por ello, hasta que encuentre un trabajo más estable seguirá poniendo todo su empeño para crecer en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa runs a shoe shop. Before this, she worked selling shoes in a market, in a relative’s shop. This is where she learned about the trade. After a while, she left her job to work for herself and tried to set up a business selling clothes. After a year she decided to branch out into selling other items for women. On moving to San Martin from Porres she decided to join forces with another relative and return to try her luck with a shoe business. Luckily, it all worked out and now she has almost been in business for a year. Luisa states that she feels ready for anything, always looking for ways to develop, not only for herself but for the sake of her three young children

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El actual negocio de la señora Luisa es su zapatería. Anteriormente ella ha trabajado como zapatera dentro de un mercado en el negocio de un familiar. Es ahí donde aprende el oficio del calzado. Después de haber trabajado un tiempo se independizó e intento hacer negocio en la confección de ropa. Durante un año ella se dedicó a aplicarle acabados a distintas prendas para mujeres. Al momento de mudarse a San Martin de Porres ella decide juntarse con otro familiar y volver a probar suerte en un negocio de calzado. Felizmente le fue bien y ahora esta a punto de cumplir un año en su local. Luisa afirma que se siente capaz de todo buscando siempre el progreso, no solo por ella sino también por sus tres menores hijos.

loans.use: To improve her service, selling women clothes and products

loans.name: David

texts.es:
The purchase and sale of sheep and cows has always been the work of David and his family. As a young father, he was responsible, along his wife and eight-year-old child, for the future of this business. Not too long ago things were going very well, both with his family and business. Unfortunately his loving wife became ill. This grieved him, but at the same time it gave him strength to continue sacrificing to gain money to cover the costs of his wife's medical bills so that she would recover quickly. David would like to take advantage of the large expanse of property that he inherited from his parents. He hopes to increase his capital in order to invest in his business while at the same time dedicating himself to the growing of vegetables. He promises to give this endeavor his best in order to see his business grow and to ensure his wife's complete recovery. With your kind heart he will realize this wish in short time.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de compra y venta de ganado ovino y vacuno siempre ha sido la labor de don David y su amada familia, él como padre joven y vigoroso trata de sacar adelante este negocio y a través de el a su pequeña niña Janeth de 8 añitos y a su querida esposa Noemí.Hasta hace poco tiempo todo le iba de maravillas, tanto en el ámbito familiar como en su negocio, desafortunadamente su amada esposa enfermó, este hecho lo acongojó pero al mismo tiempo le dio mayor fortaleza para seguir esforzándose a fin de tratar de reunir dinero para seguir cubriendo los gastos de medicamentos de su esposa para su pronta recuperación.David desea sacar provecho a la gran extensión de propiedades que heredó de sus padres, con ese fin desea aumentar el monto de su capital para invertirlo en su negocio de compra y venta de ganado y al mismo tiempo dedicarse a la producción de vegetales.Así mismo promete poner lo mejor de sí para cumplir su propósito de ver florecer su negocio y ver totalmente recuperada a su amada esposa, con tu buen corazón este anhelo se concretará en un corto tiempo.

loans.use: To invest capital to increase production

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth and her beloved partner, Juan, make a happy couple. It has been eight years since their marriage, and during this time they have made a great sacrifice to build their home. They wanted to offer their three children a proper home and to maintain a small plot of land to raise and nourish their animals. These animals have made them appreciate nature, and beyond the raising of animals and the production of cheese they also purchase and sell calves. With these labors they are gaining their day to day subsistence and bettering their way of life. At the same time they are able to support their humble and aging parents and repay them for their own efforts to support their own children. Janeth and her husband's wish is to obtain a loan in order to invest in the purchase of fodder for their animals. They believe that with your kind heart they will realize their wish.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Janeth y su querido y ejemplar compañero, Juan, conforman una feliz pareja de esposos, hace sólo 8 años contrajeron matrimonio, en ese tiempo con sumo trabajo y dedicación lograron construir su casita para ofrecerles un hogar propio a sus 3 pequeños niños y comprar un terrenito para criar y alimentar a sus tiernos animalitos.La familia de esta laboriosa ha inculcado en ellos el amor y la valoración por la naturaleza, además de la crianza de animales y fabricación de quesos con la leche que extraen de sus generosas vaquitas, ahora se dedican a la compra y venta de becerritas, con estas labores están logrando día a día mejorar su calidad de vida y al mismo tiempo contribuir con sus humildes y ancianos padres en contribución al apoyo y bienestar que recibieron de ellos.El deseo de Janeth y su esposo es conseguir un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de forraje para sus vaquitas. Están seguros que con tu buen corazón contribuirá con su gran anhelo.

loans.use: To purchase fodder to nourish their cows

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
The district of Umachiri is located 3.904 meters above sea level. It is a zone well known for its stock farming, and Alejandro's family is well-acquainted with this honest work. They have dedicated themselves to this work for many years. Alejandro was once a carpenter, but after realizing that carpentry did not yield enough money to cover his familial costs he decided to become a stock farmer. After great effort and dedication he decided to invest his savings in the purchase of cows and sheep. Since Alejandro must leave very early in the morning to feed his cows, his lovely wife is left to care for their 4 young children and to watch over the sheep as they pasture around the limits of their humble home. This family's wish is to obtain fodder for the nourishment of their animals. They believe that by providing good care, safekeeping, and nutrition their animals will in turn provide a large quantity of milk for the production of cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El distrito de Umachiri está ubicado a unos 3904 msnm, es una zona eminentemente ganadera y la familia de don Alejandro no es ajena a esta noble labor, ellos desde muy temprano se dedican a cumplir esta sacrificada labor al mismo tiempo complaciente actividad de producción y pastoreo.Anteriormente don Alejandro se dedicaba a la carpintería, pero al ver que no lograba cubrir todos sus gastos familiares con este trabajo decidió dedicarse a la producción de ganado, es por ello que con esfuerzo, dedicación y mucho más empeño logró juntar un capital para adquirir vaquitas y ovejitas.Mientras Alejandro desde muy temprano abandona su hogar para alimentar a sus vaquitas su amada esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus 4 pequeños niños y a pastar a sus ovejitas por los alrededores de su humilde casita.El deseo de esta familia es adquirir forraje para la alimentación de sus animalitos, ellos consideran que brindándoles un buen cuidado, dedicación y nutrición sus vaquitas les proveerá de una buena cantidad de leche para la elaboración de quesos.

loans.use: To purchase fodder to improve the nutrition of their animals

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Ms Julia is a mother of 5 children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Despite her advanced age, she continues to give her best in order to help her family. Ever since she was a young girl she learned the honest work of stock farming and agriculture, a knowledge she has passed downed to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life. Ms Julia and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce delicious cheeses. They sell these on the weekends in the city of Ayaviri. As a result of the inclement weather, they have decided to purchase and store fodder for the nourishment of their animals. It is with this end that they ask for your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Julia, es madre de 5 hijos, muy empeñosa y dedicada, pese a su avanzada edad sigue dando lo mejor de sí, para sacar adelante a su familia, desde muy niña aprendió la noble labor ganadera y agrícola, conocimientos que también transmitió a sus queridos hijos y con los que ahora se ha trazado la meta de mejorar su calidad de vida y la situación económica de su familia.Ella y su esposo iniciaron su negocio de compra y venta de ganado sólo contando con una vaquita, luego de innumerables esfuerzos pudieron poco a poco aumentar la cantidad de becerritas, actualmente con el apoyo de sus hijos ya adolescentes viene dedicándose a la producción y elaboración de deliciosos quesos que cada fin de semana comercializan al por mayor en la ciudad de Ayaviri, ahora viendo las inclemencias del tiempo decidieron comprar forraje para preveer y reservar la alimentación de sus generosos animalitos.Es con ese fin recurre a tu generosa ayuda para solicitarte gentilmente un préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase fodder to feed livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is a relatively young woman, full of energy and with a lot of desire to work and begin new businesses. She has spent ten years working in her older sister's sewing and baking workshop. At the beginning she was not a part of the business until five years ago when she had the idea to implement a baking workhop into the textile sewing services. Due to this, the time that she spends in the workshop is greater. She is thankful to her sister for giving her this opportunity but she currently plans to open her own workshop in her home because being outside of her house all day impedes her from taking care of her 8 year old son. Aside from this, she also is thinking of becoming a distributor for gas for cooking. For all of this she countson the support of her husband, working as a bricklayer, is in charge of the home maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Irma es una mujer relativamente joven, llena de energía y de muchos ánimos para trabajar y emprender nuevos negocios. Ella actualmente lleva diez años trabajando en el taller de teñidos y confección de su hermana mayor. Al inicio no formaba parte de la empresa, hasta que hace cinco años ideo implementar el taller de confección con el servicio de tenidos de textiles también. A raíz de esto el tiempo que ocupa en el taller es mayor. Ella agradece a su hermana por darle esta oportunidad, pero actualmente ella planea abrir su propio taller en su casa en un tiempo, pues el estar fuera de su casa todo el día impide ocuparse de su pequeño hijo de ocho años. Muy aparte de ello también está pensando ser una distribuidora de gas de cocina. Para todo esto ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabajando como albañil se encarga del mantenimiento del hogar.

loans.use: Invest in her work to be able to become independent in a short period of time

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Ms Martina and her husband Gregorio's small and humble home is located more than 3904 meters above sea level in the district of Umachiri. They built their home more than 11 years ago. As a consequence of their love, they care for three enchanting children who are the reason for their efforts in their daily labor.

At the moment Gregorio and his family live in his aging parents' home. It is his responsibility to provide for his parents' well-being and tranquility in the last years of their lives. Gregorio and his hard-working wife have always dedicated themselves to raising livestock, and with the profits that they have obtained they are providing their children with an education. In order to increase their economic revenue they intend to genetically invigorate their cows by artificially inseminating them. This will improve the production of milk.

Your indispensable contribution will help this family realize its wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

A más de 3904 msnm (metros sobre el nivel del mar), exactamente en el distrito de Umachiri está ubicado la pequeña y humilde vivienda de doña Martina y su esposo Gregorio, ambos formaron su hogar hace más de 11 años, fruto de su amor albergan a 3 encantadores niños, quienes son la razón de su esfuerzo y constancia diaria en su labor. Actualmente don Gregorio y su familia viven en la casa de sus ancianos padres, a quienes también tratan de ofrecerles bienestar y tranquilidad en los últimos años de sus vidas, Gregorio y su laboriosa esposa siempre se dedicaron a la producción de ganado y con las ganancias que han ido obteniendo están brindándoles educación a sus menores hijos; ahora para aumentar aún más sus ingresos económicos pretenden mejorar genéticamente su ganado vacuno mediante la inseminación artificial y de esta manera mejorar la producción y productividad de leche. Tu indispensable aporte concretará los anhelos de esta familia. La fotografía nos muestra a su trabajadora mujer y no ha Gregorio por su incursión en la feria de su ciudad para la venta de algunos de sus ejemplares.

loans.use: Invest capital to increase productivity of livestock

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro is a very hard working and multi-faceted man. He has 3 kids and it is for them that he works so hard every day. He was unable to complete secondary school because of his parents’ financial situation. This is why, since he formed his own family, he has been producing livestock, an activity that is helping to improve their quality of life and their family home. Mauro’s greatest desire is to give his family security and their own roof – this is why he is asking you to find it in your heart to give them a loan, so that he can finish the project that he already started. Mauro and his family are waiting for help from you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Mauro es un hombre muy trabajador y multifacético, es padre de 3 niños razón por los que trabaja arduamente y se esfuerza todos los días, no pudo concluir sus estudios secundaros porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos.Por esa razón desde que formó su familia decidió dedicarse a la producción de ganado, actividad con la que está logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y con el que pretende terminar de refaccionar su casita. El deseo más grande que tiene es brindarles seguridad y un techo propio con ese fin recurre a tu solidario corazón para solicitarte un préstamo a fin de culminar con satisfacción el proyecto que ya inició.Mauro y su familia se encuentran en espera de la ayuda de tu buen corazón.

loans.use: An injection of captial to finish home improvements/Inyección de capital para concluir el mejoramiento de su hogar.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Irma Zonia

texts.es:
With the prior experience of trying out natural medicine products on her son when he was ill, she decided to market them and sell them with the goal of generating more income for her home. However, Sonia does not only work at selling natural remedies but she also has gotten together with a group of friends to offer catering for various events.

Even though it would be enough for anybody to work at two jobs, Sonia does not know the meaning of the word tiredness and decided that she could and had time for one more task; she is willing to work at whatever she need to. This is how, in addition to her two small businesses, she sells typical Peruvian food on the weekends outside of her home. Sonia is definitely a woman and mother that is capable of many things that is why she is currently planning to open a restaurant in a strategic place with her family. This is not only to generate income but also give steady work to her friends.

When it comes to her family life, she is very happy to be able provide her two minor children with the education that they need. She is also happy in being able to count on her husband’s support in all her projects, including the culmination of the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Con la previa experiencia de haber probado la eficacia de unos productos de medicina natural en su hijo cuando este enfermó, decidió empezar a promocionarlos y venderlos con la idea de generar un ingreso mas para su hogar. Sin embargo, Zonia no solo se dedica a vender medicina natural, ella, junto con un grupo de amigas, se han unido hace un año para ofrecer el servicio de buffet para diversos eventos según el contrato.

Aunque pueda resultar suficiente para cualquiera contar con dos trabajos, Zonia no conoce la palabra cansancio y pensó que si podía y tenía tiempo para uno más, ella estaba dispuesta a seguir trabajando en lo que fuere. Es así que, además, de estos dos pequeños negocios, los fines de semana ella vende fuera de su casa algunas comidas típicas del Perú. Definitivamente, Zonia es una mujer, madre de familia, que es capaz de muchas cosas, por ello, hoy en día, planea abrir un restaurante en un lugar estratégico junto con un familiar, esto no solo parar generar ingresos para ella sino también, para darle trabajo fijo a sus amigas.

En el aspecto familiar ella se siente muy contenta al poder brindarle a sus dos menores hijos la educación que ellos necesitan. También está contenta de contar con el apoyo de su esposo en todos sus proyectos, incluyendo la culminación de la construcción de su casa.

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in the venue of natural remedies

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis and Dionisia have been happily married for 15 years. They used to live in Luis’ parents house, but 7 years ago they moved out. Luis raises livestock. At the start, things were very difficult for Luis as he did not know a lot or have a lot of experience in this, but with hard work and dedication, and with support from his faithful wife, Dionisia, he has managed to do very well in his daily work, and he now has quite a few calves and lambs. He wants to improve the financial situation of his family and give his 3 kids a good education. This is why he perseveres every day. He would now like to buy some roughage so that his animals will eat well in all seasons. With this project in mind, Luis is asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Luis y Dionisia, tienen 15 años D. feliz matrimonio, anteriormente vivían en el domicilio D. sus padres, pero hace 7 años decidieron independizarse, Luis se dedica a L. producción D. ganado, en un principio las cosas para don Luis fueron muy difíciles, porque no tenía experiencia ni suficiente conocimiento en esta actividad, pero con constancia, dedicación y con el apoyo D. su fiel esposa Dionisia logró mejorar notablemente su labor diaria, actualmente ya es propietario D. una buena cantidad D. becerritas y corderitos. Desea mejorar su situación económica familiar y brindarles educación a sus 3 queridos hijos, con ese fin se esfuerza y persevera día a día.Ahora previniendo las inclemencias del tiempo tiene pensado adquirir forraje para tener asegurada L. alimentación D. sus animalitos en posibles tiempos difíciles.Con ese proyecto en mente recurre a vosotros para solicitar tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy roughage and balanced foods for their animals/Compra de forraje y alimentos balanceados para sus queridos animalitos.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra has a snackbar where she sells fried foods prepared in different ways. She began the business 3 years ago. At first, she helped a friend sell tostadas. Bit by bit, she saved what she made until, 2 years ago, she had saved enough to start a business of her own at home. She's married with 3 children, 10, 8, and 5, and her husband is a "comerciante" (merchant or shopkeeper, perhaps). She wants to help her husband with household expenses and so provide a better quality of life for their children.

She's now applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy new merchandise that her customers have asked for such as cold drinks and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Sandra tiene un snack, donde vende frituras preparadas de diversas formas,, esto empezó hace 3 años, al principio le ayudaba a un a amiga a vender tostadas con este dinero poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta que hace 2 años junto el capital suficiente y decidido iniciar el negocio ella sola en su casa. Es casada tiene 3 hijos de 10,8 y 5 años, y su esposo es comerciante. Ella desea apoyar a su marido en los gastos familiares y así brindarles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 3 meses para comprara mercancía nueva que sus clientes les están solicitando como refrescos y dulces.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma makes a living selling cosmetics, work that she took on because of the necessity to help pay household expenses and to avoid neglecting her children's schooling. She also uses lunch hours to sell perfumes to the teachers at her children's school. Her husband works as a laborer and his income isn't enough to cover all of their expenses. They have 3 children, 12, 9, and 4, all of whom are in school.

Norma is applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and generate more sales. With your help, Norma can move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Norma se dedica a la venta de cosméticos actividad que desempeña por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar, y no descuidar a sus hijos con la escuela., además aprovecha las horas del almuerzo para vender perfumes a las maestras de la escuela de sus hijos. su esposo trabaja como obrero y el sueldo que percibe no es suficiente para salir adelante con todos los gastos. tienen 3 hijos de 12, 9 y 4 años todos ellos se encuentran estudiando.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y así generar más ventas. Con tu apoyo Norma saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana started her business 2 years ago. She used to help her mother sell jewelry, but then decided to set up her own business. The jewelry business requires a long investment, though, and she hasn't been able to stand out because she only buys small amounts of merchandise. With the help of loans, though, she wants to invest in more merchandise. Her husband is a construction worker and they have 3 children, 12, 8, and 2. Faced with the need to help her husband with household expenses, she decided to start the business.

Juana is now applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your contribution, Juana will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Juana inició su negocio hace 2 años le ayudaba a su mama a vender joyería, después decidió emprender un negocio propio pero la joyería requiere de mucha inversión por lo cual no ha podido sobresalir mucho porque compra poco mercancía pero con la ayuda del crédito quiere invertirlo todo en esta. Su esposo es albañil y tienen 3 hijos de 12, 8 y 2 años, ante la necesidad de apoyar a su marido con los gastos familiares fue que decidió iniciar el negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu contribución Juana prosperara.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha started a small general store 3 years ago. Her husband was laid off and they set up the business with some of the money he received from his employer. She felt that it was necessary to do something for the family expenses when she knew that her husband would be out of work for a while. Thanks to her hard work, thing have gone very well but she'd like to have a larger business and she needs loans for that.

Martha is asking for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise and have more stock on hand so that she can attract more customers. With your help, Martha can meet her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Martha M. tiene una mercería, inicio hace 3 años porque a su esposo lo liquidaron y pusieron el negocio con algo de ese dinero, ya que la sentía la necesidad de hacer algo por el gasto familiar al saber que su esposo estaría sin trabajo una temporada. Gracias a su esfuerzo le ha ido bien pero a ella le gustaría tener mas grande su negocio por eso necesita un crédito.

Ella solicita US $475 que esta dispuesta a pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mejor surtida la mercancía, y así atraer mas clientes. Con tu ayuda Martha lograra su meta.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asuncion started working as a laborer, working 12 hours a day, with the goal of making money to pay expenses for the birth of his son and then, sadly, for funeral expenses to bury the child who was born dead. While he was paying off the expenses, he made the decision to start his own business so that he could spend more time with his wife. Nine years ago, he began selling iced deserts and fresh fruit that to this day have provided him a good income and a way to pay for all he needs.

Asuncion is applying for a US$775 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy basic ingredients for his food business because he expects his sales to go up as the weather gets warmer over the coming months. He hopes that with Kiva's support, he'll get the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Asunción inicio trabajando como obrero cubriendo un horario de 12 horas, mantuvo este empleo con el fin de obtener mas ingresos para solventar gastos del nacimiento de su hijo y posteriormente los gastos funerarios, ya que desgraciadamente su hijo nació muerto. En la medida en que fue solventando todos sus gastos tomo la decisión de emprender su propio negocio y así estar más tiempo con su esposa. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de nieves y frutas que hasta hoy en día le ha dejado buenos ingresos y ha podido solventar todas sus necesidades.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito de US $775 a 6 meses, para la compra de materia prima ya que se acerca la temporada de calor que es cuando mas ventas genera. El tiene la esperanza que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly and her husband started one year ago a business selling weight-management products from a well known brand. They grew little by little until they could open a store where to sell the products and where they also train new sellers.

This has become their full-time employment and they work hard everyday to improve their quality of life, especially for their 4 year old daughter.

They plan is to invest in more merchandise and later on open another store.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Magaly y sus esposo desde hace un año emprendieron el negocio de vender productos reductores de peso de una reconocida marca mundial. Ellos dedican todo su tiempo a esto. Poco a poco han ido creciendo hasta que lograron abrir un club de estos productos que funciona como tienda de estos productos y a la vez como capacitadores para nuevos vendedores. Ambos se esfuerzan día a día para poder surgir y llevar una mejor vida, no solo por ellos sino por su hija que tiene cuatro años. Sus planes para un futuro es invertir más en su mercadería y abrir más adelante otro club-tienda.

loans.use: To buy more weight-management products

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
Nicolas was born and bred in the countryside, and this is why he loves to work in it. All his life he has worked in agriculture and farming, activities about which he is very knowledgeable and in which he has a lot of experience. His finances have not allowed him to get a good education, and this is why he has dedicated himself to farming. His greatest desire is to provide a full education for his 4 kids, a chance he never got due to his parents’ lack of money, and it is with this goal in mind that he works hard every day. While this dedicated and responsible father works every day, his faithful wife does her bit in agriculture, and both of them do this with the aim of giving their lovely kids a better quality of life and a good education. Nicolas and his wife want to genetically improve their animals, and it is with this in mind that they are looking to your generous hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Nicolás, es un hombre que nació y creció en el campo, es por ello que ama el trabajo en este espacio, durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la ganadería, actividades en las que tiene un amplio conocimiento y experiencia, sus posibilidades económicas no le permitieron seguir estudios superiores, es por ello que decidió dedicarse íntegramente a la noble labor ganadera.El deseo más grande que tiene es proveerles estudios superiores a sus 4 queridos hijos, oportunidad que él nunca tuvo por los escasos recursos económicos de sus padres, con ese propósito en mente se esfuerza diariamente.Mientras este dedicado y responsable padre se dedica a su labor cotidiana, su fiel esposa hace lo propio con la agricultura, así ambos ponen lo mejor de sí para cumplir su propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida y educación de sus amados hijos.Don Nicolás y su esposa tienen pensado mejorar genéticamente cada uno de sus animalitos, con ese propósito en mente recurren a cada uno de vuestros generosos corazones.

loans.use: An injection of capital for the plan of improving animal breed/Inyección de capital para mejorar el proyecto de mejoramiento de raza de sus animalitos.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Producing livestock and making delicious cheeses has become the main and indispensable income for Leonidas’ family. He and his wife come from humble backgrounds, and with a lot of hard work they have been able to stay close to nature and work with it. Following Leonidas’ parents example, he tries to give 100% to everything he does, thereby earning well and improving his family’s financial situation. Now that his kids need more and more financial support for their studies, Leonidas knows he needs more income, and this is why he thought of genetically improving the breed of his animlas so the productivity of milk of each of his calves would improve. Leonidas and his family need your support to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La producción de ganado y la elaboración de deliciosos quesos se ha convertido en el ingreso económico indispensable de la familia de Leonidas. Él y su querida esposa provienen de familias muy humildes con gran voluntad de trabajo que siempre mantuvo un lazo estrecho con la madre naturaleza y el trabajo en ella.Siguiendo el ejemplo de sus padres don Leonidas trata de poner su mayor esfuerzo a cada actividad que realiza, con el fin de obtener buenos ingresos y mejorar su situación económica familiar.Ahora que sus hijos le van demandando mayores gastos por los estudios que vienen realizando se ve en la necesidad de incrementar más sus ingresos, es por ello que tiene pensado mejorar genéticamente la raza de sus animalitos para aumentar la productividad de leche de cada una de sus tiernas becerritas.Don Leonidas y su familia recurren a vuestro apoyo para salir adelante.

loans.use: Some capital in improve the breed his breed of animal/Inyección de capital para mejorar la raza de sus animalitos.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de Dios is a very responsible man, and when he was only 19 he had the great responsibility of becoming a father. Now he is 31 he has 3 kids who he adores, and they help him to carry on going as a farmer. Along with farming, Juan and his lovely wife Antonia work in agriculture, which is an activity they know a lot about and have a lot of experience in. Due to this fact they are very happy with the results of this business. Thinking about their good calves, Juan would like to buy some roughage to give them better nutrition, and therefore increase the productivity of their milk. This would give him income enough to cover their most urgent needs. With your contribution you will help Juan and his family’s projects.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juan de Dios es un hombre muy responsable, a la edad de 19 años asumió la gran responsabilidad de ser padre, actualmente a sus 31 años ya alberga a 3 inquietos niños quienes son su mayor adoración y el motor que lo impulsa a seguir adelante perseverando con su noble labor de ganadero.Adicionalmente a la producción de ganado don Juan y su querida esposa Antonia se dedican a la agricultura, actividades que con su amplio conocimiento y experiencia vienen desenvolviéndose eficientemente y se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos por los resultados que han ido obteniendo.Pensando en sus generosas becerritas don Juan tiene pensado comprar forraje para mejorar la alimentación de sus animalitos y por ende mejorará la producción y productividad de leche, ingresos con el que también cubrirán sus necesidades más urgentes. Con vuestra contribución permitirás concretar los proyectos de don Juan y su querida familia.

loans.use: To buy balanced foods to better nourish his cows/Compra de alimento balanceado y forraje para mejorar la nutrición de sus vaquitas.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Their education is the most important inheritance Eulalia and her husband, Lucio, can give to their dear kids. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their kids the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditure, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their production. Eulalia and her family are waiting for your quick response.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La educación es la mejor herencia que desean brindarles doña Eulalia y su esposo Lucio a sus queridos hijos, ambos son padres muy responsables dedicados a la agricultura y ganadería, se esfuerzan y perseveran con el fin D. darles la oportunidad D. concluir estudios superiores a sus 4 retoños, oportunidad que ellos nunca tuvieron por sus bajos recursos económicos.Esta feliz madre desD. que formó su familia se dedica a la agricultura y con el apoyo D. su incondicional esposo a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, gracias a los ingresos que perciben por esta actividad es que están logrando cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes.Pero ahora que sus gastos van en aumento desea solicitar un préstamo para incrementar su capital D. trabajo y por enD. su radio D. acción.Eulalia y su familia se encuentran en espera D. tú pronta respuesta.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to increase their production/Incremento de capital de trabajo para incrementar su radio de acción.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Since she moved into her current home, Julia has been trying her luck with different types of businesses, such as a general store, clothing sales, selling food from her house, etc. When she was dismissed from her job at the end of the 1980's, she has always tried to find a way to generate income to help cover the costs of her home. Despite the fact that her husband works as a driver, they have generally needed extra income for any emergency that always seem to happen.

Currently, Julia works to prepare food according to the orders that people ask her for. This is not daily work and this allows her to work lending her domestic services in a residential area of Lima as well. Her dream is to get capital and invest in a big business. All of this is with the goal of being able to give a good education to her daughters, ages 20 and 14.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Desde que se mudó a su actual vivienda, Julia ha estado probando suerte en distintos tipos de negocio, ya sea en bodega, venta de ropas, vendiendo comida en su casa, etc. Cuando la despidieron de su trabajo a fines de los ochentas, siempre ha visto el modo de cómo generar recursos que ayuden a cubrir los gastos de su casa. A pesar de que su esposo trabaja como chofer, generalmente, siempre se necesita de un ingreso extra para cualquier emergencia que nunca faltan. Actualmente, Julia se ocupa de preparar comida según los pedidos que algunas personas le hacen. Este trabajo no es diario, es por esto que le permite trabajar también prestando sus servicios domésticos en una zona residencial de Lima. Su sueño es obtener un buen capital de trabajo e invertir en un negocio grande, todo esto con el fin de poder darles una buena educación a sus hijas de 20 y 14 años.

loans.use: Investment for a new business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 30 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 9 months and 7 years. Amina owns a small retail shop, which she started in 2001. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Salma's Mikanjuni A Group

texts.en:
Salma is married with 1 child, age 20. Salma is a fish and cloth seller; she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Pili and Mwanahamisi, who have businesses dealing in groceries.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 50 years old and is divorced. Pili owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Asha's Tropicana Group

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old and is divorced woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 3 years old. Asha is a cloth seller, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Habiba and Mwajuma, who have businesses dealing in Medical store and cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Asha's Tropicana Group

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old and is divorced with 2 children, ages 10 and 3. Asha is a cloth seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Habiba and Mwajuma, who have businesses dealing in a medical store and cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 32 years old and is married with 1 child, age 8. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 3. Angelina is a cloth and shoes seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 7:30 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina J., who comes from the small town of Raiwind, Pakistan, is married with two children: one girl and one boy. Both of her children attend a local school and she hopes that they will be able to do well so that they can find successful jobs in the future. Nagina’s husband, who is a rickshaw driver, had an accident with his rickshaw, and now they are in need of a loan to get it fixed.

There are several other women in her loan group including: Rubina B., who wants to invest in her wheat business; Ramzana B., who wants to expand her wood business; Parween N., who wants to get her rickshaw fixed and Rehana B., who will buy a donkey cart.

loans.use: Fix a rickshaw

loans.name: Paulina's Imani Group

texts.en:
Paulina is 35 years old and is divorced with 3 children, ages 17, 10, and 5. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 14, 12, and 7. Paulina is a fruits (banana) seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Laurencia and Fatuma, who have businesses dealing in charcoal and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for her business

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
My name is Khursheed Z. and I am from Raiwind, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of two girls and two boys. My eldest daughter is married and my eldest son embroiders clothes. There is currently a high demand for embroidered clothes, therefore we would like a loan to expand our business to take advantage of this growing business opportunity.

I am also the leader of my loan group that is comprised of the following women: Mussarat J. who sells cloth; Arshad B. who has a vegetable business; Amin B. who has a lumber yard business ; and Sakina B. who also has a vegetable business.

loans.use: Expand clothing embroidery business

loans.name: Annie's Group

texts.en:
My name is Annie J., I am married with six children, and I have lived all my life in Raiwind, Pakistan. As I did not receive education when I was young, I do not want the same fate to befall my kids. Therefore, I enrolled all my kids to school, all of whom have continued except for one son, who paints buildings. My husband is also a painter and paints buildings on contract. We would like to request a loan to buy paint brushes, a ladder and few other related items.

I have been joined in my loan group by several other women who are: Parween A., who needs a loan for her gas cylinders business; Shamim A., who is borrowing for her communications office; Suriya B., who wants to fix her car’s engine; and Martha B. who will invest her share of loan in her lumber yard.

loans.use: Buy paint brushes, ladder and few other related items

loans.name: Sikia

texts.en:
Sikia is 30 years old and is single. She takes care of 3 people, ages 52, 16, and 12. Sikia is a cereals seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Koser's Group

texts.en:
My name is Koser S. and I am the group leader of four women. We all reside in Raiwind, a small lush green town in Pakistan. I am a mother of two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school, except for my youngest son. Working from home, my main business activity is selling jewelry to the women of neighboring areas. As the high season for jewelry sales is commencing , I would like to request a loan to buy a stock of jewelry for my business. I would like to save a small portion of my monthly income to collect a dowry for my daughter, along with buying other furniture for my home.

My sub group members are: Koser A. who wants to buy cloth; Basheera B. who makes powdered salt; Mussarat B. who is in the livestock trade business and Shaheen B. who wants to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: Expand jewelry business

loans.name: Rukia's Upendo Center Group

texts.en:
Rukia is 35 years old and is divorced. She takes care of 1 person, age 56. Rukia is a firewood seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tajiri, who has a business dealing in fish selling.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
Balqees N. is married and a mother of two boys. Her eldest son attends a local school in grade two and she would like to see both her kids finish their schooling successfully. Balqees helps her brother-in-law to embroider and decorate clothes while her husband works as a sweeper at a local school. She is borrowing from Asasah, a microfinance institution, to invest in her brother-in-law’s embroidery business which gives her a reasonable monthly income.

The other women in her group who are also requesting loans include: Zeenat B., whose husband repairs roads; Rubina B. who sells cloth; and Haneefa B. who wants to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: Invest in a clothing embroidery business

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 44 years old and is widow woman. Mwanakombo is owns a small food vendor store and she is a fish seller, which she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 44 years old and is a widow. Mwanakombo owns a small food vending store, and she is a fish seller, a business she started in 2001. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 29 years old and is married with 1 child, age 9. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 19. Fatuma is a food seller; she started her business in 2008. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 29 years old and is married woman with 1child, age 9 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 19 years old. Fatuma is a food seller, she started in 2008. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 28 years old and is single. Mwajuma is a cloth seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Sylvia's Mikanjuni Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is 24 years old and is single with 1 child, age 6. Sylvia owns a small shop, and she is a charcoal seller, which she started doing in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tonaji, who has a business dealing in a salon and cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia A. S., born in Raiwind, Pakistan, is married and a mother of three: two boys and one girl. She belongs to a poor family but she has high hopes for her kids whom she plans to send to school. Her husband runs a small restaurant and they need a loan in order to improve their business.

Her loan group has several other women who would also like to improve their businesses: Rehana B. sells milk; Safia I. wants to buy animal fodder; Zainab B. would like to improve her family’s food stall and Shahnaz S. wants to buy a cow.

loans.use: Improve restaurant

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
My name is Ramzana R. from Raiwind, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five: two boys and three girls. I would like all my kids to finish school. I embroider and sew clothes whereas my husband drives a tractor to transport sand and cement on order. The tyres of his tractor have deteriorated and we need to replace them.

I would like to request a loan for my group so that other women can also improve their businesses. Balqees B. sells dry fruits; Salma B. needs to fix her tractor; Kaneez B. wants to buy an electric loom (a machine used to manufacture cloth); Mamena B.‘s family operates an auto workshop; and Hussain B. would like to expand her tea stall.

loans.use: Buy new tyres for the tractor

loans.name: Asha's Magaoni Centre Group

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 19, 18, and 16. Asha is a cloth (khanga) seller; she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ziada, who has a business dealing in chips selling.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Born in the small town of Kot Radha Kishan, Sharifan L. moved to the nearby town of Raiwind, Pakistan after her marriage. She is a mother of eight children, five boys and three girls, of which four are already married. She and her youngest daughter both embroider and sew bed sheets. She makes these bed sheets on order from a big cloth market in the city Lahore. Currently, she requires an additional embroidery machine in order to improve her services.

Her sub group members are Razia B. who runs a restaurant; Reshma B. and Zubaida B., who both required embroidery machines; and Najma B. who would like to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: Buy an additional embroidery machine

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is 40 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 5 to 20. Zaina is a cloth seller; she started her business in 1998. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 35 years old and is married woman with 4 children, ages 8-15 years old. Bahati is a vegetables seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 35 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 8 to 15. Bahati is a vegetables seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Mboni

texts.en:
Mboni is 28 years old and is married with 3 children, ages12, 4, and 1. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 23. Mboni is a bedsheet seller; she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more bedsheets for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets for her business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 20 years old and is married with 1 child, age 6. Christina is a cloth seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
My name is Mussarat A., I am married and a mother of seven children. I reside with my family in Raiwind, Pakistan where all my children attend a nearby school. Both my husband and I work, he runs a salon, while I am a health worker. I received one year training on health services under the government health programme. My husband would like to expand his business, thus we required a loan to buy more items for his salon.

My group has four other women who also require loans to expand their businesses: Zareen F. sells cloth; Koser S. needs to expand their restaurant; Rubina B. wants to buy wood and Kalsoom B. would like to start a fruit-selling business.

loans.use: Expand beauty salon

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
My name is Halima A. and I am a mother of two girls and two boys. Originally from the city of Faisalabad, I moved to Raiwind, Pakistan twelve years ago. My eldest daughter is married and all my other children attend school. I am a health worker and provide health services for women at my clinic, located at a nearby market. Raiwin is a small city with few clinics, and I would like to expand my clinic.

My friends who also require loans for their businesses include: Suriya B., who will fix her tractor; Shahnaz M., who wants to buy a dairy cow; and Mumtaz M., who wants to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: Expand medical clinic

loans.name: Yulissa Beatriz's Group

texts.es:
Yulissa and Elisa have belonged to the Brilliant Communal Bank for 6 months and 1 year, 6 months respectively. They are from the community of Mollepata that this located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Yulissa lives in a shared home. She is 26 years old and has 3 children. Yulissa and her husband manufacture native bricks that they sell to distributors.

Meanwhile Elisa also lives in a shared home. She is 32 years old and has 1 daughter of 6 years. Elisa has a store where she sells meat, groceries and vegetables.

Yulissa and Elisa need loans of 900 soles and 600 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of firewood, rice, noodles, sugar and eggs.

The dreams of Yulissa and Elisa are to build their own houses, that their children become professionals and to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Yulissa y Elisa pertenecen al Banco Comunal Brillantes hace 6 meses, 1 año, 6 meses respectivamente. Ellas son de la comunidad de Mollepata que esta ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Yulissa es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, Yulissa junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales y lo venden a intermediarios.

Mientras que Elisa es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hija de 6 años, Elisa tiene una tienda donde vende carne, abarrotes verduras.

Yulissa y Elisa necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, arroz, fideo, azúcar, huevo.

Los sueños de Yulissa y Elisa son construir su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy firewood, rice, noodles, sugar and eggs for their brick and grocery businesses.

loans.name: Delia Gloria's Group

texts.es:
Marciana and Gloria have belonged to the Brilliant Communal for 6 months and 1 year, respectively. They are from the community of Mollepata that this located 20 minutes from of the city of Ayacucho.

Marciana lives in a shared home. She is 54 years old and has 9 children. Marciana has a store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables and meats, an activity that she has carried out for 2 years.

Meanwhile Gloria also lives in a shared home. She is 37 years old and has 4 children. Glory sells firewood both wholesale and in smaller quantities. She carries out her sales by distributing to stores.

Marciana and Gloria need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, candles, noodles and firewood.

The dreams of Marciana and Gloria are that their children become professionals, to have more capital for their business and to build their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Marciana y Gloria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Brillantes hace 6 meses, 1 año respectivamente. Ellas son de la comunidad de Mollepata que esta ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Marciana es conviviente, tiene 54 años y 9 hijos, Marciana tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza hace 2 años.

Mientras que Gloria es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Gloria vende leña por mayor y menor, sus ventas lo realiza repartiendo a las tiendas.

Marciana y Gloria necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, vela, fideo, leña.

Los sueños de Marciana y Gloria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener más capital para sus negocios y construir su casa.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, candles, noodles and firewood for their grocery and firewood businesses.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44009

loans.name: Dora's Group

texts.es:
Teofila, Aleeda and Dora have belonged to the Sumaq Wasi (“Pretty House”) Communal Bank for 6 months.

Teofila lives in a shared house. She is 28 years old and has 1 son of 4 years. Teofila sells food on foot. In addition, Teofila is a cashier in the city transportation department.

On the other hand, Aleeda is a single woman. She is 22 years old and is pregnant. Aleeda prepares decorative chocolates that she sells in institutions. In addition Aleeda has a family business selling wood. With the loan that she will obtain, she plans to fix up a family car for the transportation of the merchandise.

Meanshile Dora also lives in a shared house. She is 32 years old and has 5 children. Dora sells clothes to order. She sells her products to friends and family. In addition Dora works as housemaid in the mornings.

Teofila, Aleeda and Dora need loans of 1000 soles, 600 soles, and 600 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of dishes, an oven, rice, sugar, polos, blouses, sweaters and for the repair of the car.

The dreams of Teofila, Aleeda and Dora are that their children study, to improve their economic situation and to have more supplies for their business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Teofila, Aleeda y Dora pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sumaq Wasi que significa “ Casa Bonita” hace 6 meses.

Teofila es conviviente, tiene 28 año y 1 hijo de 4 años, Teofila vende comida de manera ambulatoria. Además Teofila es cobradora en las unidades de transporte urbano.

Por otro lado Aleeda es soltera, tiene 22 años y esta embarazada, Aleeda prepara chocolates artesanales que vende en instituciones. Además Aleeda tiene un negocio familiar de venta de maderas. Con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado hacer arreglar un carro de su familia para el transporte de la mercadería.

Mientras que Dora es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 5 hijos, Dora vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los vende a amigos y familiares. Además Dora por las mañanas trabaja como empleada del hogar.

Teofila, Aleeda y Dora necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de platos, cocina, arroz, azúcar, polos, blusas, chompas y para la reparación del carro.

Los sueños de Teofila, Aleeda y Dora son que sus hijos estudien, mejorar su situación económica y surtir más su negocio.

loans.use: To buy dishes, an oven, rice, sugar, polos, blouses, sweaters and for the repair of a car to transport merchandise.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl C. has always been a sales man; he has the ability to communicate well and to sell his products.

Some time ago he had to pay some extra home expenses and his salary was not enough. He therefore decided to sell calendars and business cards in order to get an extra income. That is how 8 years ago he started his own business printing and selling calendars and business cards. Ever since he has been able to cover his household’s expenses and get extra resources to pay for his children’s education.

As he was an experienced seller and knows many people, he is able to sell most of the products he prints.

He now requests a loan of US $950 that he will pay within 6 months. This loan will allow him to print new calendars and business cards for which he has pending orders. As he will certainly sell those products, he will be able to quickly recover the money he will invest.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Raúl C. inició el negocio ya que siempre ha trabajado en las ventas y tiene facilidad de palabra para poder colocar los productos que vende. Por eso se inclino a poner su propio negocio que le permitiera tener un ingreso extra para su familia. Tenia que pagar unos gastos de la casa y el dinero que sacaba en su empleo no le alcanzaba, por eso se puso a vender calendarios y tarjetas por su cuenta. De esa manera pudo obtener mas recursos para sacar adelante a su familia y sobre todo a sus hijos porque cada vez es mas difícil darles escuela.

Comenzó hace mas de 8 años con el negocio de los almanaques y tarjetas, y ya traía yo cierta experiencia de ventas por esa razón como ya estaba empapado del negocio abrió su propio negocio y le ha ido muy bien porque conoce mucha gente y aprovecha para ofrecerles sus productos y logra colocar la mayoría de lo que produce.

Solicita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crédito le va a ayudar para sacar otro tiraje de tarjetas y almanaques que tiene pendientes, y como ya es segura la venta va a recuperar muy pronto el dinero que esta invirtiendo.

loans.use: To print new calendars and business cards for which he has pending orders

loans.name: Maura's Group

texts.es:
Dora and Maura have belonged to the Sumaq Wasi (“Pretty House”) Communal Bank for 6 months.

Dora lives in a communal home. She is 43 years old and has 3 children. Dora and her husband have a business processing cereals and milk. They sell their products to different stores in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Dora sells cosmetics via a catalogue.

Meanwhile, Maura is married, 44 years old and has 2 children. Maura sells cereals, groceries and vegetables from her house.

Dora and Maura need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, respectively; money that will be invested in the purchase of soy, arverja (a vegetable used to make flour), quinua (a native grain), perfumes, sugar, rice, oil and cereals.

The dreams of Dora and Maura are to have a larger business, to offer a good education to their children and to have more supplies for their business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Dora y Maura pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sumaq Wasi que significa “ Casa Bonita” hace 6 meses.

Dora es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Dora junto a su esposo tienen un empresa de procesamiento de cereales y lácteos, sus ventas lo realizan a las diferentes tiendas de la ciudad de ayacucho. Además Dora vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Maura es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Maura vende cereales, abarrotes, verduras, en su casa.

Dora y Maura necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de soya, arverja, quinua, perfumes, azúcar, arroz, aceite y cereales.

Los sueños de Dora y Maura son tener un negocio más grande, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y surtir más su negocio.

loans.use: To buy soy, arverja (a vegetable used to make flour), quinua (a native grain), perfumes, sugar, rice, oil and cereals for their cereal production and grocery businesses.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosaria is a widow and has 2 sons who are 32 and 30 years old. She started her business because sometimes her children didn’t have enough money to give her and therefore she didn’t have enough resources to cover the household expenses. She says “I was in despair and had to find a way to start working and earn some money in the short term”.

Some years ago she started selling shoes, covers and other products. Now she sells shoes from a catalogue and the business is doing very well. Every month she has a big amount of orders as people always buy her shoes.

She now asks for a loan of US $475 that she will pay within a month. This loan will help her to pay a pending order and fulfill the obligation she has toward her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Rosario es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya mayores de 30 y 32 años. Inició el negocio por La necesidad de no tener los recursos suficientes para los gastos de su casa y ya que sus hijos no siempre tenían para darle por eso en la desesperación tuve que buscar la forma de ponerme a trabajar y ganar dinero a corto plazo.

Todo comenzó hace alguno años y desde entonces ha vendido calzado, colchas y otras cosas de las que se vaya pudiendo, ahorita esta vendiendo calzado por catalogo, y le esta yendo muy bien porque cada mes tiene gran volumen de pedidos y la gente siempre le compra.

Solicita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 1 mes. Este crédito le va a ayudar para sacar un pedido de calzado que tiene pendiente y poder cumplir con el compromiso que tiene con sus clientes.

loans.use: This loan will help her to pay a pending order and fulfill the obligation she has toward her clients

loans.name: Rosalba Guadalupe
