texts.es:
Rosalba is a widow and she started her business when her husband died. She had difficulties to cover the household expenses; she had to pay debts and to raise her family. She therefore decided to do something about it, to open her own business and to work hard.

She decided to open a gym as she had many acquaintances who did sports.

She started her business 15 years ago and she has been very successful. She has clients that go to her gym daily and even when she changed the location, they kept on going to her gym.

She now requests a loan of US $575 that she will pay within 6 months. She will use this loan to buy equipment for the gym.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosalba es viuda e inició el negocio cuando murió su esposo tuvo que ponerse a trabajar muy duro ya que los gastos que tenia eran muchos demás de muchas deudas y tenia que sacara adelante a su familia y no podía quedarse de brazos cruzados, por eso emprendió su propio negocio y opto por abrir un gimnasio ya que tiene muchas conocidas que practican ejercicio.

Comenzó con el negocio hace más de 15 años y desde entonces ha tenido mucho éxito ya que tiene un gran grupo de mujeres que van a su gimnasio a practicar, a pesar de que he cambiado de dirección la siguen buscando.

Solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crédito la va a ayudar para poder comprar equipo para el gimnasio.

loans.use: To buy equipment for the gym she owns

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María de la Paz is married and has two children ages 13 and 10, both of whom are students. Her husband works as an employee of a business in their area. She started the business four years ago to contribute to the family expenses, as there were frequent money shortages. Four years ago she began selling household items by catalog, and now she buys packages and sells much more.

She requests a loan of $775, which she will repay over 6 months, to remodel her store and be able to exhibit more merchandise. With your help María will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María de la Paz es casada y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años, ambos son estudiantes. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de la localidad. Inicio su negocio para solventar los gastos familiares ya que las carencias eran muchas hace 4 años inicio con la venta de artículos para el hogar por catalogo, actualmente compra por paquetes y vende muchos mas.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y poder exhibir más mercancía. Con tu apoyo María saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Remodel store

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra C. considers herself to be a very serious, hard-working, and honest person. She is a widow and has four children: Margarito, 29 years old, studies and works as a secondary school teacher; Luis Gerardo, 27 years old, is employed; Martha Alejandra, 25 years old, is employed; and Blanca Estela, 23 years old, is married. Only Margarito and Luis Gerardo live with her.

She started her business because when her husband was alive, sometimes his work wasn’t steady and she wanted to help him with the household expenses. She opened a grocery store in March 1985 when her husband was still alive. He worked as a clerk and she attended the store. As their house was on a busy street, they built a wooden store on the patio of their house. They have done well and her son Luis is a carpenter, and he has been expanding the store a little bit and now they are remodeling it because they would like to expand it.

She is requesting a loan of $400, to be repaid over 5 months, to purchase wood and paint, as well as have lettering done, which will make their store look more presentable and large to give their customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandra C. se considera una persona muy seria, trabajadora y honesta. Es viuda y tiene 4 hijos Margarito de 29 años, estudia y trabaja como maestro de secundaria; Luis Gerardo de 27 años, trabaja; Martha Alejandra de 25 años, trabaja y Blanca Estela de 23 años, casada. Solo Margarito y Luis Gerardo viven con ella.

Inició el negocio porque cuando vivía su esposo a veces no le iba muy bien en su trabajo y ella quiso ayudarlo con los gastos de la casa. Abrió una tienda de abarrotes en Marzo de 1985 cuando todavía vivía su esposo, el trabajaba como empleado y ella atendía la tienda y como su casa quedaba en una calle muy transitada, acondiciono el patio de su casa y puso un local de madera pequeño, como le ha ido muy bien y su hijo Luis es carpintero, la ha estado ampliando un poco mas y ahora la tiene en remodelación porqué quiere hacerla mas grande.

Solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar madera y pintura, y mandar hacer algunas rotulaciones, lo que hará que su tienda se vea más presentable y amplia para darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase paint, wood and make signs

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores cooks and sells food. She is married and has 3 sons, who are 20, 18 and 14 years old. Her husband is a trailer driver. She started her business in order to help her husband with the household expenses as he does not have a fixed income.

She started her business 17 years ago in a small shop where she only sold fast food. She has ever since developed her business and she now sells complete meals.

She currently requests a loan of US $250 that she will pay in 3 months. With this money she will buy a 4-burner grill that she needs. She hopes that your help will make this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María Dolores se dedica a la venta de comidas. Es casada y tiene tres hijos varones de 20, 18 y 14 años, su esposo trabaja como operador de un tráiler. Inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar ya que el no tiene un ingreso fijo. Hace 17 años empezó primero con un pequeño snack donde vendía frituras, y después lo convirtió en un negocio de comidas.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un quemador de 4 parrillas que le hace falta. Ella confía que con tu ayuda podrá hacerlo posible.

loans.use: To buy a 4-burner gril that she needs to cook food

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Señora Melania has made a living by making bread for one year. Her small bakery offers bread to everyone who lives inside and outside her community. She has dedicated herself to this business for one year. She also sells cosmetics and clothing.

Doña Melania is an enterprising, positive woman. She hopes in the future to be able to grow her business to the degree that she can make deliveries of bread to small grocery stores so she can capture new customers that value the quality of her products. As time goes by, she hopes to be able to diversify her products and reach new segments of the market. She will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Melania se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde hace un año, su pequeña panadería les ofrece pan a todas las personas que viven dentro y fuera de su comunidad, la Sra. tiene un año de dedicarse a este negocio, como actividad adicional también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa.

Doña Melania es una señora emprendedora, positiva, espera que en un futuro su negocio pueda crecer al grado de hacer entregas de pan a las pulperías y por ende acaparar cada día nuevos clientes que valoren la calidad de su producto, con el paso del tiempo ella espera lograr diversificar su producto y llegar a nuevos segmentos de mercado. El préstamo lo invertirá en compra de materia prima para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make bread

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Señor Pablo M. M. is an elementary school teacher in one of the schools in Managua. He likes his profession because he feels that he is contributing to the intellectual and social development of children. He also likes to involve himself completely in the activities of his community, with the aim of contributing to the sports in his community to keep young people from vices and delinquency.

Don Pablo is single, is 49-years-old, and one of his biggest dreams is to someday see his house completely built and to live in a house worthy of all his efforts at work. He hopes to be able to use this loan to purchase construction materials to finish building a room. He will pay this loan back in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Pablo M. M. es profesor de primaria de uno de los colegios de Managua, le gusta su profesión porque siente que contribuye con la formación intelectual y social de los niños, además, le gusta involucrarse de lleno en las actividades de su comunidad con el fin de contribuir con el desarrollo del deporte de su barrio y de esa manera apartar a los jóvenes de los vicios y de la delincuencia.

Don Pablo es soltero, tiene 49 años y uno de sus más grandes sueños es ver un día su casa de habitación construida totalmente, para así vivir en una casa merecedora de todos sus esfuerzos de trabajo. Espera poder utilizar el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la edificación de un cuarto. Este préstamo lo pagará en cuotas mensuales a 12 meses de plazo.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make a room in his home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es:
Señora Eva is a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She makes a living by selling shoes, food, and clothing that she makes herself, depending on the needs and preferences of her customers. Doña Eva started her business with the goal of supporting her husband economically, and in this way, obtaining more income that would help solve their family expenses in a big way.

Doña Eva has 3 school-aged children. Her husband works in an upholstery business. Both work on their own, and until today, their businesses have grown positively. With effort, both have managed to take good care of their family and have improved their quality of life at the same time. One of her big dreams is to grow her business and obtain better equipment. Doña Eva needs this loan to invest in merchandise that she will later offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Eva es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de zapatos, comida y ropa que ella misma elabora en dependencia de las necesidades y gustos de su clientela. Doña Eva inició su negocio con el fin de apoyar a su esposo económicamente y de esa forma lograr mayores ingresos que ayudarían de gran manera a solventar los gastos familiares.

Doña Eva tiene 3 hijos en edad estudiantil. Su esposo se dedica al negocio de la tapicería, ambos trabajan por cuenta propia y hasta hoy sus negocios han ido creciendo positivamente. Con el esfuerzo de ambos han logrado sacar adelante a su familia y a la vez han mejorado su nivel de vida. Uno de sus grandes sueños es lograr que su negocio crezca y de esa manera obtener mayores utilidades, doña Eva necesita de préstamo para invertirlos en mercadería que posteriormente ofrecerán a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes to offer to her customers

loans.name: Fatima Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima C. is married and has an 8-year old daughter who is an elementary school student. Her husband works as a temporary laborer for PEMEX, a Mexican oil company. She started her business because she’s always liked sales and it would allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. She would like to create wealth for their daughter and for their next child, as she is pregnant. Three years ago she selling shoes by catalog, which has given her a good income.

She currently needs a loan of $250, to be repaid over three months, in order to fill her pending orders. With your contribution, Fátima will be able to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Fátima C. es casada y tiene una hija de 8 años que es estudiante de primaria, su esposo labora como empleado eventual de PEMEX. Inicio el negocio porque siempre le han gustado las ventas y de esa manera apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que desea forjar un patrimonio para su hija y para el próximo que viene ya que esta embarazada. Desde hace 3 años empezó con la venta de calzado por catalogo actividad que le ha generado buenos ingresos.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir pedidos pendientes. Con tu contribución Fátima lograra progresar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther has a small grocery store. Her husband works as a caretaker of a country house and they have four children, two girls ages 14 and 6, and two boys, ages 12 and 2. She undertook the business as her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover the household expenses and school tuition for their children. 8 years ago they opened a snack shop and little by little they invested in it until it became a grocery store.

She currently needs a loan of $250, which she will repay over 3 months, to expand her business. With your help María will be able to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María Esther tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Su esposo se dedica a l cuidado de una quinta y tienen 4 hijos dos mujeres de 14 y 6 años, y dos hombres de 12 y 2 años. Emprendió su negocio ya que el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente para solventar los gastos de la casa y además los de la escuela de sus hijos, por lo que hace 8 años abrió un snack y poco a poco le fue invirtiendo hasta tener un tienda de abarrotes.

Actualmente necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para ampliar su negocio. Con tu apoyo María podrá alcanzar sus metas.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Señora Noemí is married and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She has a one-year-old boy. Her husband is a cabinet maker, and he helps her a lot with their homes expenses. She decided to work on her own with the goal of making more income.

This woman's business is selling filing cabinets, display cabinets, and tires. She has always worried about offering good service to her customers and having high quality products. This is why she hopes that her business is more prosperous in the future. She is requesting this loan to buy filing cabinets, display cabinets, and tires to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Noemí es casada, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene un niño de 1 año de edad, su esposo es ebanista y le ayuda en gran medida con los gastos del hogar. Se decidió a trabajar por cuenta propia con el fin de percibir mayores ingresos.

El negocio de esta señora es vender archivos, vitrinas y llantas. Ella siempre se ha preocupado por brindar una buena atención a sus clientes y que sus productos sean de calidad. Es por esta razón que ella en un futuro espera que su negocio sea más próspero. Este préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar archivos, vitrinas y llantas para ofrecele a sus clientes

loans.use: To purchase display cabinets, filing cabinets, and tires

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
Doña Fátima G. is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Her husband makes a living by painting and doing body work on cars. Both work very hard to pay for their home's expenses.

Fátima started her business by selling fruits and vegetables. She now also sells food and beverages. Her business is set up in her home, and she usually sells her food by delivering orders. She has been progressing her business for 13 years. She hopes that her business can grow in the future so she can leave a good inheritance to her children and a decent home with better comforts.

She needs this loan to buy sand and cement to finish constructing a room in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Fátima G. es una señora de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos que están en edad escolar. Su esposo se dedica al enderezado y pintura de vehículos. Ambos trabajan arduamente para sufragar los gastos del hogar.

La señora inició su negocio con la venta de frutas y verduras, ahora también se dedica a vender comidas y refrescos, el negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa de habitación y la comida la vende generalmente por encargos, ya tiene 13 años llevando adelante su pequeño negocio. Ella espera que en un futuro su negocio pueda crecer para dejarle un buen patrimonio a sus hijos, una vivienda digna y con mejores comodidades.

Requiere del préstamo para comprar arena y cemento para terminar de construir un cuarto en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To purchase sand and cement to finish constructing a room in her house.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pablo M. is a hardworking, enterprising man. He likes to work for his community, collaborating in different activities within his neighborhood with the aim of obtaining benefits from institutions that support many of Managua’s poor neighborhoods.

Mr. M. currently runs a general store in which he offers his customers a great number of products. He is a 51-year-old, married father of an underage daughter. His wife is an elementary school teacher who is also the school principal.

One of Pablo’s aspirations is to one day own a distributor where he could sell wholesale products, and of course provide his customers with better service. He is requesting a loan in order to finish constructing a room in his home. He will repay this loan in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Pablo M. es un hombre muy emprendedor, trabajador, le gusta trabajar por su comunidad, colabora en diferentes actividades comunales dentro de su barrio con el fin de lograr que su comunidad logre beneficios a través de Instituciones que apoyan los diferentes barrios pobres de Managua.

El Sr. M. actualmente tiene una pulpería donde ofrece una gran cantidad de productos a sus clientes, esta casado, tiene 51 años y de el depende solamente una hija menor de edad, su esposa es profesora de primaria y se desempeña como directora de un colegio.

Una de las aspiraciones de don Pablo es llegar a tener un día una distribuidora, donde pueda vender productos al por mayor y por supuesto darle una mejor atención a sus clientes. El esta solicitando el préstamo para terminar de construir un cuarto en su casa de habitación, este préstamo lo pagará a 12 meses de plazo en abonos mensuales.

loans.use: Finish construction of a room in his home

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
This client is a person who has worked in the public hospital in Managua for 10 years. She is an assistant nurse, is 56-years-old, and is married. Her children are adults and support her economically. Her husband is a taxi driver and also contributes to the financial well-being of their home.

Doña Lucila has a goal in life of seeing her house completed. She hopes that with the effort of everyone in her family and with the support of our institution, she can see this dream fulfilled and have a decent home. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the construction of a porch or terrace. This will allow her family members to have a pleasant place to rest at the end of each day's work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Esta clienta es una persona que labora en un hospital público de Managua desde hace 10 años, ella es enfermera auxiliar, tiene 56 años, es casada, sus hijos son mayores de edad y le apoyan económicamente, la profesión de su esposo es taxista, quien también contribuye con los gastos de la casa.

Doña Lucila tiene como meta de vida ver un día su casa de habitación terminada, espera que con el esfuerzo de toda su familia y el apoyo de nuestra Institución pueda ver realizado su sueño como es tener una vivienda digna. El préstamo que está solicitando Doña Lucila es para invertirlos en la construcción de un porche o terraza. Esto permitirá a sus familiares contar con un lugar agradable para descansar luego de la jornada de trabajo del día.

loans.use: To construct a porch on her home

loans.name: Umi

texts.id:
There are a lot of motorcycles passing by Kupaon street and this gave idea to Mrs. Umi F. and her husband to open a motorcycle repair shop which also sells motorcycles spare parts.

The shop opens everyday from 08.30 am to 05.30 p.m. and it has a lot of customers. This makes her overwhelm. She plans to use the loan money to buy more merchandises (spare parts) for her shop.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Begitu banyaknya sepeda motor yang melintas di Jalan Kupaon membuat Ibu Umi F. dan suaminya membuka usaha bengkel sepeda motor dan suku cadangnya seperti oli, busi, ban dan lain-lain. Ibu Umi F. membeli alat-alat bengkel dari supplier yang datang ke tokonya. Karena begitu banyaknya pelanggan Ibu Umi F. sampai kewalahan, karena pelanggannya bukan saja penduduk sekitar tetapi juga mereka yang kebetulan lewat di Jalan Kupaon. Kadang stoknya habis dan Ibu Umi harus mencari ke toko di wilayah Denpasar. Pinjaman kali ini rencananya akan dipergunakan sebagai tambahan modal untuk pengadaan suku cadang dibengkelnya. Setiap hari Ibu Umi buka jam 08.30 dan tutup jam 17.30.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mohammad Hayoub

texts.en: Mohammad Hayoub lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail shop and has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. Every day he works hard to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to enlarge his shop and buy more food items for his business. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank lenders who help poor people around Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and buy more food items

loans.name: Habib Allah

texts.en: Habib Allah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a single boy who has a small tire repair shop where he works. He has a good number of clients and he wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to buy a new machine and complete some smaller purchases. He wants to make a good income to help his family and make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To buy a new machine

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum V. lives in Kampong Pou Village in Kandal Province and she is 47 years old. She is the mother of five children, two of whom attend school while the others are working. They can generate an income of around $4.25 per day. Her husband, Mr. Vann Nhim, is on the right of the photo; he has his own field and he usually works with his wife. Mrs. Tum V. and her husband cultivate many different kinds of vegetables but now they lack money to buy more seeds. Thus, Mrs. Tum V. decided to access a loan to buy vegetable seeds.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokchea P., 44, lives in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer and is married with four children. One child works in a garment factory, while the others are attending school. Her husband, Mr. Sok Soung, is pictured on the left in the photo. He is a farmer with a cultivatable field next to the village and can earn about $1.50 per day. Because of her poor living condition, Mrs. Sokchea P. doesn’t have enough money to buy vegetable seeds, and thus she would like to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: I Nengah Sedra

texts.id:
I Nengah Sedra is a diligent and tenacious farmer, who strives to meet his family’s needs. His wife does not work, and thus, he carries the burden alone through his farming income to meet his family’s needs. I Nengah Sedra works on a 1-hectare farm owned by his parents. His family’s daily expense is quite expensive especially since his children are still in school. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming equipment, seeds and supporting materials require a larger capital, which he didn’t have. I Nengah Sedra is relieved that DINARI is helping him get a loan he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. I Nengah Sedra rents a tractor to till his farm because he doesn’t have an ox to do the job. I Nengah Sedra is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes to yield better results from his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs, and if there is still some money left, he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

I Nengah Sedra seorang petani yang sangat rajin dan ulet, semua dilakukan supaya ekonomi keluarga bisa tercukupi. Apalagi istrinya tidak mempunyai penghasilan tambahan sebagai pendukung keuangan keluarga. I Nengah Sedra hanya mengandalkan penghasilan dari pertanian untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. Sawah yang dikerjakan seluas 1 hektar dan itu pun masih menjadi milik orang tuanya. Biaya yang dikeluarkan setiap hari cukup besar apalagi anak-anaknya masih duduk dibangku sekolah. Sedangkan dari hasil panen yang diperoleh tidaklah maksimal karena dalam pengolahan tanah maupun pembibitan dan pemeliharaan tidak bisa dilakukan dengan maksimal,ini semua karena terbentur dengan modal. Tetapi sekarang I Nengah Sedra sudah merasa lega karena adanya pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari untuk menunjang usahanya dibidang pertanian. Modal tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit unggul,pupuk organik dan juga obat pestisida. Pengolahan tanah dilakukan dengan menyewa traktor, karena I Nengah Sedra tidak mempunyai sapi untuk membajak. Kini I Nengah Sedra sedang menunggu panen tiba, ia sangat berharap panen kali ini berhasil dan mendapat keuntungan yang meningkat dari panen sebelumnya. Keuntungan ini nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk menunjang pendidikan anak-anaknya dan apabila ada sisa I Nengah Sedra ingin sekali bisa memperbaiki rumahnya yang belum selesai dibangun.

loans.use: To buy quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn S. is a clothing seller and lives in Roteang Village in Kandal Province. She is 58 years old and is married with eight children. Three of the children are working and two others are enrolled in school; the others are too young to study or work. Her husband, Mr. Toun Teoun, who is on the left in the photo, is a farmer and can generate a small income.

Mrs. Horn S. usually faces a problem during the rainy season because no customers come to buy her products. The family typically spends money on vegetable seeds, as well as on Mrs. Horn S.’s business and everyday family expenses. In order to expand her business, she now wants to apply for a loan to buy more clothes to sell in the village.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Kampong Svay Ii Group

texts.en: The Kampong Svay II group consists of twelve members, and Mrs. Bunthin S. is the leader. She is 40 and is the mother of four children, two of whom stuD.. The others stay at home. Mrs. Bunthin S. is a grocer and she also runs a lottery business in the village. Her husband, Mr. Meng Hong, is a house builder. Last year, her children fell ill, and to cure them Mrs. Bunthin S. spent around $10 for each child each time they were sick. She has had a loan from another microfinance institution, which she used to buy groceries to sell. Now she would like to request a loan to fix the ceiling of her house.

loans.use: To fix the ceiling

loans.name: Si Im Teim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Si Im T. is a group leader of a group with four members in Doeum Porpel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 25 years old and is the mother of two children, both too young to study or work. She is a grocer in the village; her husband, Chanroeurn Va, is a laborer who makes a small income to help support his family.

Mrs. Si Im T. has faced a problem with her business, because she doesn’t have enough money to invest in inventoR.. Thus, she needs to request a loan to buy groceries to sell in the village.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

payments.comment: The two members in this group have finished the loan term already: Mrs. Si Im Teim and Sarim Ry repaid $150 each to finish the loan term. Additionally, Mr. Sophorn Teim has repaid $27 as an extra repayment.

loans.name: Pann

texts.en:
Mrs. Pann M. is 57 years old and lives in Or Soursdey Village, Kompong Thom Province. M. sells groceries and earns about $2.33 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chan Samon, is 71 years old. He repairs motorcycles and bicycles, earning about $2.16 per day. They have five children, three of whom are married and two are single.

Because of the family's increasing expenses, M. sends one of her sons to work as a laborer outside the country and another one works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.

M. requests a loan of $700 to purchase grocery stock to sell, especially before Khmer New Year. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle. M. hopes this loan will help her support her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to sell and a motorcycle

loans.name: Ny Yun Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny Y. is a grocer and lives in Au village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is also the leader of a group with four members. She has four children, one of whom is a farmer and one of whom is enrolled in school. The two youngest are still too young to work or study. Her husband, Soth Pon, is a subsistence farmer. Their income comes principally from the sale of groceries and rice, and they use this income to support the family and pay for expenses.

This year, Mrs. Ny Y. has a lot of rice, but she does not have enough money to transport her rice and sell it for a better price. Thus, she would now like to have access to a loan to hire a car to transport her rice.

loans.use: To hire a car to transport her rice

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton B. is a 55-year-old farmer who earns around $3.50 per day. She lives with her husband Sok Kuon and her five children in the Kork Srok Village, Siem Reap Province. Kuon, 45, makes $3 per day as a bricklayer. Some of their children are students, while others earn $2.50 per day as bricklayers.

To help sustain her business and expand for the future, B. seeks a loan of $400 to improve her farming business by purchasing more oxen.

loans.use: To improve her farming business by purchasing more oxen

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma has been working in her little shop, located inside her home, for 15 years. When she moved to her present location, she thought that it would be a good idea to invest her time doing something productive that would improve her and her family’s then financial status. She has always considered herself to be a hardworking and enterprising woman, which is why she has stocked her shop with an assortment of products. Nine years ago, she started selling beauty products as well.

Additionally in her spare time, she maintains her small orchard, where she now harvests fruits such as lucmo (a subtropical Peruvian fruit), figs, and avocados. Perhaps she will also sell fruit sometime in the future; however, she would like to be able to expand her business space so that she can have more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace quince años Vilma se dedica a atender en su pequeña bodega ubicada en su casa. Cuando se mudo a su actual vivienda ella pensó que seria buena idea invertir su tiempo haciendo algo productivo y que mejorara la situación económica que en ese entonces su familia tenia. Desde siempre se considero una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, por ello ha ido implementando su tienda con diversos productos, es así que desde hace nueve años también se dedica a vender productos de belleza.

Por otro lado, en sus tiempos libres se ocupa de darle mantenimiento a su pequeño huerto, donde ya puede cosechar algunos frutos, tales como la lúcuma, el higo y la palta. En un futuro se dedique tal vez a vender frutas también; sin embargo, ella quisiera poder agrandar su local para poder tener mas mercadería.

loans.use: Increase merchandise to boost sales

loans.name: Ceneida

texts.es:
Ceneida is a woman who arduously pushes her business daily so that it can progress. She is a mother of 3 children ages 11, 8, and 5. She, alongside her husband, is in charge of supporting her children and covering the household expenses.

She has been running her general store for 4 years, and at present, she sells practically everything. She and her husband previously used to sell clothing at a stand in a market, where they managed to establish their business, which operated for 8 years. Nevertheless, she felt the need to be closer to her children, who were still young at that time. For this reason, she decided to hand the clothing store over to her sister-in-law. While her husband went to work outside of Lima, she decided to open a general store in her home.

Lately, Ceneida has been planning to return to clothing sales, since she now has the help of a niece who would be in charge of minding her general store. This time, however, she would like to sell clothing door-to-door because she claims that it is more amusing this way.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ceneida es una mujer que, con arduo esfuerzo, empuja a diario su negocio para que avance hacia adelante. Ella es madre de tres niños quienes tienen 11, 8 y 5 años. Junto a su esposo, se encarga de mantener a sus hijos y los gastos de la casa.

Hace cuatro años que trabaja en su bodega y, hoy en día, vende prácticamente, de todo. Anteriormente a este trabajo, ella y su esposo se dedicaban a vender ropa en un puesto dentro de un mercado, donde lograron establecerse y en el cual paso ocho años. Sin embargo, ella sintió necesario estar mas cerca de sus hijos que en esa época estaban muy pequeños aun. Es por ello que decidió darle a su cuñada la tienda de ropa y mientras que su esposo se fue a trabajar fuera de Lima ella se animó a abrir una bodega en su casa.

Últimamente, Ceneida planea volver al negocio de venta de ropa, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de una sobrina quien se encargaría de atender su bodega. Pero esta vez vendería ropa por reparto, ofreciéndolas casa por casa; ella dice que es mas divertido hacerlo de este modo.

loans.use: Invest in a new clothing business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Twenty years ago, Rosa felt the need to do something to generate additional income (apart from her husband’s earnings), so she started selling what little she could offer to her customers. At that time, her children were still very young, and it is for them that she has been prospering in her business this whole time.

The majority of her children are now independent, which is why the profits gained from the business are basically for her and her husband, who is a retiree of the national police. Rosa R. suffers from diabetes, and she just underwent surgery for a diabetes-related complication not too long ago. Nevertheless, this illness does not weaken her. On the contrary, it fills her with more strength to be able to convert her shop into a bookstore in the near future because she considers this business to be more lucrative.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Empezó vendiendo lo poco que podía ofrecer a sus clientes. Hace veinte años Rosa se vio en la necesidad de hacer algo para generar un ingreso económico más (muy aparte que el que su esposo producía). En ese entonces, sus hijos aun estaban pequeños y por ellos es que durante todo este tiempo ha ido progresando en su negocio.

Actualmente sus hijos ya son , en su mayoría, independientes; es por ello que las ganancias que su negocio produce las destina básicamente para ella y para su esposo quien es jubilado de la policía nacional. Rosa R. sufre de diabetes y no hace mucho acaba de ser operada por una complicación de esta enfermedad; no obstante, esto no la debilita, al contrario, la llena de más fuerzas para poder convertir, en un tiempo, su tienda en una librería; ya que considera es un negocio mas rentable.

loans.use: Restock her general store with a greater variety of products

loans.name: Block A North 2043-02 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Flora M..  Her current business is selling groundnuts.  Flora is 33-years old, is married, and her husband is a  security guard .  She has 7 children ages 9 to 17, and all of her children go to school.  Flora earns approximately 100 sudanese pounds a week  selling nuts. She is requesting a loan so she can branch out in her business efforts and buy a motor-bike so she can offer transportation service. Flora is joined in her small group by Veronica E., Grace L., Charity F., and Margret J..  Veronica E. has sells vegetables and wants to contract a shop.  Grace L. is currently operating a business selling breads and wants a loan to pay school fees.  Charity F. operates a business selling beans and wants to construct a house to rent to others.  Margret J. is currently in the business of sellng breads and is requesting a loan to construct an oven for breadmaking.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for transportation services

loans.name: Block A North 2043-03 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Rebbecca J..  She is sells various items at a small shop.  Rebbecca is 42-years old, married, and her husband works as a  security guard .  She has 4 children ages 5 to 24, and all of her children go to school.  Rebbecca earnsapproximately 200 sudanese pounds a week, and she is requesting a loan to expand her retail business. Rebbecca is joined in her small group by Zuzela A., Jenifa A., Christine M., and Hellen P..  Zuzela A. has a business sells breads and wants a loan to pay school fees.  Jenifa A. sells vegetables and wants a loan to pay school fees.  Christine M. also sells breads and wants to open up restaurant.  Hellen P. is sells sugar and is requesting a loan to construct a small shop.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Heourn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heourn S., 33, is the group leader of a group of four members in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a grocer in the village and she doesn’t have any children. Her husband, Lor Kouk, is a driver who drives a motorbike with a cart and can generate a very small income to help meet the needs of his family.

Mrs. Heourn S.’s business faces an obstacle: many villagers buy her groceries on credit. Therefore, she doesn’t have capital to invest in her business. At the moment, her husband's cart needs to be repaired, and she doesn’t have money, so she decided to apply for a loan to fix the cart.

loans.use: To fix her husband's motorcycle cart

loans.name: Confort

texts.en:
Confort M. is a seamstress and also sells footwear and clothing material. She is married and has two children. She is working very hard to contribute to her family’s expenses. Business is going well and she wants to expand her business but lacks enough funds.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional funds to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional funds to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 44045

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a trader who owns a provision store. She is married and has two children. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. She is working very hard to support her husband in meeting the family’s expenses. She wants to increase her income.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44046

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is a trader who sells pastries. She is single and has no children. She is focused on expanding her business but lacks enough capital.

She is asking for $125.00 as additional capital to buy more materials for production and sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more materials for production and sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rotana Yart Group

texts.en: Mr. Rotana Y. leads a group of five members in Neang Mealea Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a 25-year-old farmer who cultivates many different kinds of vegetables. He is married to Mrs. Von Sok, who works in a garment factory and generates a small income that helps support her family. Rotana and Von do not have any children yet. They need their own house, so Rotana decided to apply for a loan to build a house in the village.

loans.use: To build a residential house

loans.name: Nusmira

texts.en: Nusmira was born in 1960 and she is a widow. She lives alone, near the town of Tuzla. Her monthly pension from her husband is 600 KM (about US$ 480). Nusmira wants to use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 for buying chickens in order to expand her little poultry business. Her wish is to improve food production and be able to fill her purchase orders.

loans.use: For buying chickens

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mirela

texts.en: Mirela was born in 1974 and she is single. Her parents are employed and their monthly earnings are 1400 KM (about U$ 1125). The previous two loans that Mirela took at MCO WWI  were in the amount of 500 KM (about US$ 400) and 1500 KM (about US$ 1200). This new loan, in the amount of US$ 975, Mirela wants to use for purchasing cosmetic products.

loans.use: For purchasing cosmetic products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hedija

texts.en: Hedija was born in 1961 and  she is married . Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is  1200 KM (about US$ 975). They have 3 adult children. This third loan in the amount of  US$ 500 Hedija intends to use to buy fertilizer and other preparations needed for cultivation of her orchard. Although she is not employed, she wants to contribute to the household budget. She will feel more satisfied if she is doing something for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, etc. for their orchard

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mrs. Farida H. lives in Dhalko. Dhalko is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores, ready-made clothes shops and so on.

Mrs. H. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Amit H. and he is a taxi driver. Her son is studying in primary school.

Four years ago Mrs. H. opened her beauty-parlor to help her husband to upgrade the standard of living of her family. She took 6 months' training for the beauty parlor work from her friend. Her service is for ladies only. Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy various types of make-up tools for her work. She wishes to spend her income to provide better education for her son.

loans.use: To buy make-up tools for her work

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Mrs. Sahida H. lives in Dhalko. Dholko is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores, ready-made clothes shops, and so on.

Mrs. H. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Manjuro H. and he works in house construction. The living conditions of her family are not good because her husband has no regular work. So sometimes her husband doesn’t have any income.

So as to overcome this problem, Mrs. H. opened her beauty parlor two years ago. She took 6 months' training for the beauty parlor work in a salon training institute in her locality. Her service is only for ladies . Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy various types of make-up tools for her work.

loans.use: To buy make-up tools for her work

loans.name: Renu

texts.en:
Mrs. Renu M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters. Her husband's name is Birendra M. and he works in a carpet factory and her daughters are studying in grade five and grade one respectively.

Renu M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Thecho. She opened her shop a year ago. She opened her grocery shop to help her husband support their family. She sells different types of grocery goods like maize, rice, snacks, and so on from her shop. Now she is requesting for her first loan of US$ 175 to buy grocery items for her shop to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi S.,a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur lives in an extended family with her mother-in-law, brother-in-law, husband and one daughter. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. S. is a shopkeeper in Thecho. Her husband's name is Hira S. and he makes different types of handicraft goods. Her daughter is studying in primary school.

Mrs. S. opened her pots and utensils shop 3 years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. Her husband also helps her in her work. Now Mrs. S. is asking for her fourth loan of US$ 400 to further expand her shop by buying items like plates, steel glasses, and hotpots for their shop to meet the increasing demand of the customers. She wants to strengthen the economic conditions of their family by increasing her income.

loans.use: To expand her household products business

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju G., a 40-year-old lady, lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming and running small businesses like grocery stores.

Mrs. G. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her older son works in a private office and her younger son is studying in grade 11.

Mrs. G. and her husband Mr. Shiddhi Bahadur G. opened their poultry farm 4 years ago. They sell chickens to the chicken dealers. They also sell chicken at retail prices in the local market. They are running their business successfully and they are happy with their income.

Now Mrs. G. is requesting her third loan of US$ 325 to expand her business to buy small chickens for her farm. They also want to expand the capacity of her farm.

loans.use: To expand her little poultry business

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuok N. is 28 years old and makes about $2.50 per day weaving large baskets to hold rice from her home in Kpub Reay Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. Her husband, So Sineth, is 26 years old and also earns $2.50 per day weaving rice baskets. They have one young child.

In order to enlarge her business, N. requests a $100 loan to buy more bamboo trees to make baskets. With the income generated by her business, N. can support her family’s expenses, as she plans to send her child to school when her child is 6 years old.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo trees to make baskets

loans.name: Shima

texts.en:
Mrs. Shima K. lives with her husband and two children in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. K. is a farmer in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. Due to the lack of new technology, she has to depend on seasonal farming. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and the evening. Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

Mrs. Shima’s husband's name is Madan K. and he works in a private office. Their son is studying in grade 12 and their daughter is studying in grade 8.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Kuku

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuku H. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in seasonal farming. Mrs. H. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Kul Bahadur H. works in a private office. Her sons are studying in grades 10 and 5 respectively.

Mrs. H. is a wholesaler in the potato business. She sells potatoes cheaply in the local market. She buys potatoes from the Kalimati bazaar which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. Now Mrs. H. is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 475 to buy potatoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for her little business

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti C., a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishapati, lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Raj Kumar C. and he works in a private office. Her son is only one year old.

Mrs. C. is a farmer in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. She grows different types of vegetables in her farm. Due to the lack of technology, most of the farmers in this area depend on seasonal farming. Nepal is an agricultural country but new technology has not been introduced yet in farming. So the production of vegetables is not enough for the population of the country.

Mrs. C. sells her vegetables in the local vegetable market in the morning and the evening. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 250 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her work.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipa K., a 35-year-old lady, lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Mrs. Dipa K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 10 and her son is studying in grade 6. Mrs. Dipa is a center chief in her group. Being a center chief she has take responsibility for her center members.

Mrs. Dipa and her husband, Mr. Ramesh K., opened their veterinary pharmacy 2 years ago. They sell different types of domestic animal medicine in their shop. They both contribute equally in their shop because they don’t have any other job.

Now Mrs. Dipa is requesting her fifth loan of US$ 475 to expand her business and buy necessary medicine for her shop.

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicines for her shop

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Ieng C., 35 years old, and her husband Say Sareth, make around $3.50 per day farming near their home in the Suong District, Kampong Cham Province. C. has two children, one of whom works on a rubber plantation in Kampong Thom Province and contributes about $0.83 per day to the family.

C. seeks a $400 loan to purchase a water pumping machine for her farming business and a used motorbike for her husband. With this motorcycle, Sareth will supplement his income by working as a motorcycle taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine for her farming business and a used motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn C. is 55 years old and a farmer in Ampil Phaem Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is married to Mr. Thou Nget, who is also a farmer; he is shown on the left in the photo. Morn C. is the mother of four children, two of whom are working in a garment factory, and one of whom helps the parents in the rice field. Another of the children is a construction foreman.

Mrs. Morn C.’s farm faces a problem with a drought and infertile land. Last year in October, her husband and children got malaria and went to a hospital,  which cost $300. Thus, she now doesn’t have money to buy her child construction equipment, and so she needs to ask for a loan to buy it.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment

loans.name: Hira

texts.en:
Hira R. lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Goam Bahadur R., and one son. She lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores. Her husband is a house painter. Her son is studying in grade 3.

Mrs. R. opened her small cafe 2 years ago to strengthen the economic situation of her family. She sells different varieties of food items in her little cafe. Especially, she prepares Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice) for her cafe. She also sells tea and coffee. Her cafe is small but very popular in her locality. So Mrs. R. is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy necessary food ingredients for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for her little cafe

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba G. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. She has finished high school. She is a seamstress by training. This is what she does now. Mahbuba works in an atelier where she sews traditional clothing. She has been doing this for 5 years. Now, that it is spring, there are more customers wanting to buy her products, this is why Mahbuba would like to increase volume of her goods. Mahbuba needs to buy cloth and ensure that her equipment functions well (fix her sewing machine). Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan amounting to $875, which will help her. Mahbuba plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Гулямова Махбуба проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ей 47 лет , она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Имеет средне - профессиональное образование. По специальности она портниха. Так и занимается своим делом. Работает в швейном ателье по пошиву национальной одежды. Занимаентся швейным делом уже 5 лет. С приходом весны спрос на ее продукцию увеличился, поэтому Махбуба хочет увеличить объем производимой продукции. А для этого ей надо закупить материал и обеспечить себя бесперебойной работой техники( отремонтировать швейную машину). Поэтому она решила получить кредит в размере 875 долларов США , который поможет ей. А погасить кредит Махбуба сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and repair the sewing machine

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.ru:
Mirzo P. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 44 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a university diploma. Mirzo is an engineer by training. Currently he does not work within his profession, but tries to feed his family by trading.

Mirzo has a place at the city market where he sells spare parts. He has been in this business for 5 years. His business helps customers obtain goods without having to leave the city and traveling to Dushanbe. In order to increase profits the client needs to raise the variety and number of goods that he offers. He brings goods from Dushanbe where he buys spare parts from wholesalers. Additionally, Mirzo would be able to increase the variety of products he offers and to meet customer needs. In order to reach his goal the client would like to obtain a loan; this is why he approached our organization.

Mirzo has a large and friendly family; they all try to help each other. He plans to repay the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Пиров Мирзо проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ему 44 года. Мирзо женат и имеет 5 детей. Имеет высшее образование по специальности инженер. Но он не работает по специальности, но старается прокормить семью, занимаясь торговлей.

Мирзо имеет торговую точку на городском рынке. Торгует запчастями. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 5 лет. Его бизнес помогает населению приобретать товар прямо у себя на рынке, не выезжая за его приделы в город Душанбе. Для того , чтобы увеличить доход, клиенту необходимо увеличить товарооборот , путем ввоза нового ассортимента товара. Привозит товар из города Душанбе, покупая у оптовых реализаторов. Кроме того он сможет увеличить предложение и удовлетворить спрос населения. Для того , чтобы достичь цели , клиент планирует получить кредит и для этого он обратился в нашу организацию.

У Мирзо большая и дружная семья, они все вместе стараются помогать друг другу. Погасить кредит его бизнес позволит в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old, married and has 2 children. She has a high school diploma, and she is seamstress by profession. Marhabo works in an atelier where she sews traditional clothing. She has 5 years of experience in this area.

Now Marhabo would like to purchase her own sewing machine and cloth in order to start her own business. But she does not have the money to do this. This is why Murhabo came to us for help. She would like to obtain a loan that would help her reach her goals. If she starts her own business she would be able to improve financial situation of her family. Additionally, customers would be able to obtain services of an experienced seamstress at affordable prices. Marhabo plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Сайдалиева Мархабо проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 26 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Образование средне - профессиональное. По профессии портниха. Работает в ателье , где шьет национальную одежду. Опыт в данной сфере она имеет уже 5 лет.

Сейчас она хочет приобрести свою собственную швейную машинку и закупить материал , для того чтобы открыть свое дело. Но для этого у Мархабо нет денег, и поэтому она обратилась к нам за помощью. Она хочет получить кредит , который поможет ей достичь целей. Если она откроет свое дело , то сможет улучшить финансовое положение своей семьи. Кроме того, население сможет пользоваться услугами портнихи со стажем и по доступным ценам. А погасить кредит сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Mastura H. lives in the region of Shahrinav. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 children. She has a high school diploma and a professional specialization. She is a cook. Mastura works at the "Dekhon" market in her region. She has a small cafe where she works as a cook. This job brings profits that give her an opportunity to provide for the family.

Now Mastura would like to expand her business. She needs to rent a new location and to buy flour wholesale. This will help her improve the quality of service and to keep prices low, because flour prices keep rising. In order to reach her goal Mastura needs a $875 loan. She will be able to repay it within 9 months. Despite her age, Mastura is a very active and cheerful woman. Her clients love her and are always happy to visit her cafe.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Холмирзоева Мастура проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 58 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Имеет средне – профессиональное образование. По профессии повар. Работает на рынке «Дехкон» в своем районе. Имеет небольшую столовую, где работает поваром . Работа приносит доход , который дает возможность обеспечивать семью.

Сейчас Мастура Хочет увеличить свой бизнес . Ей необходимо взять в аренду новое помещение и закупить муку. Это поможет ей улучшить качество обслуживания и сохранить цены на предлагаемую продукцию, так как цены на муку растут. Но для того , чтобы сделать это ей необходимо получить кредит в размере 875 долларов США. А погасить кредит она сможет в течение 9 месяцев. Не смотря на свой возраст, Мастура очень активная и веселая женщина. Поэтому клиенты любят ее и всегда будут рады посещать ее столовую.

loans.use: To purchase flour and rent a new cafe location

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigerian. Mrs. A. sells provisions, cooked food and drinks in her local community. She has been in this business for several years. She is requesting a loan of $1200 so she can buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. With this she hopes to better serve her customers. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat A. lives in the Shahrinav regions of Tajikistan. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a close and supportive family. Saodat manages her own business - she sells groceries in her own store. She brings the goods from Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan, and sells them in her home town. Saodat sells her goods with very little mark-up and as a result she has many customers. Currently Saodat wants to expand her inventory so that she can keep up with the local demand for various grocery products. To reach her goal she has planned to take out a loan. Saodat is going to pay back the loan in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Абдуллоева Саодат проживает в районе Шахринау. Ей 40 лет.У Саодат большая и дружная семья. Она замужем и у нее 4 детей. У Саодат есть свое дело . Она занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где продает продукты питания. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и продает в своем районе. Ставит совсем небольшой процент на привозимый товар. Поэтому у нее много клиентов. Сейчас Саодат хочет увеличить товарооборот , для того , чтобы увеличить ассортимент , который сможет удовлетворить спрос населения на продукты питания. Для этого она запланировала получить кредит, который поможет ей достичь поставленных целей. А погасить кредит Саодат планирует в течение 9 месяцев

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat S. lives in the Shahinav region of Tajikistan. She is 44 years old, married and has 3 children. Her family is very close and they own a business together Saodat and her husband own a market stall where they sell groceries. Her husband supplies the goods which he brings from Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. Saodat herself manages the stall and sells the goods. This business is the sole source of income for their family. Saodat and her husband have decided to expand the inventory so that they can increase their profits. However, they need a loan to reach their goal. They are planning to pay back the loan in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Саидова Саодат жительница района Шахринау. Ей 44 года, Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. У нее очень крепкая семья. И вместе они имеют общий бизнес. Саодат с мужем имеют торговую точку , где продают продукты питания. Муж является поставщиком товара , который привозит из города Душанбе. А сама клиентка торгует. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода их семьи. Поэтому они вместе решили увеличить товарооборот, который даст возможность заработать больше. Но для этого им необходимо получить кредит. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: “I love my kind of business. It gives me joy and also allows me to help my family,” says Mrs. Rose U.. Mrs. U. is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling drinks for the past 10 years. She is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more drinks for her business. She appreciates and says thanks to all who will make her loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is 39 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO member for seven years. Mrs. M. sells drinks in her community. She is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more drinks for her business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael I. is a strong and energetic woman. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and single. She sells and rents VCDs and cassettes to people in her community. She has been in this business for 2 years. Ms. I. is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more VCDs and cassettes for sale. This will help her improve her business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more VCDs and cassettes for rent and sale

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina B. A. is a trader who owns a general store. She is married and has six dependents. Business is going very well and she wants to increase her sales but she lacks enough capital.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods for sale

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44076

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. is a trader who sells tin tomatoes and other food items. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Hawa wants to increase her income to support her husband.

She is asking for $425.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 44077

loans.name: Xoname

texts.en:
Xoname A. prepares food for sale. She has two children. She is married to a mechanic whose income is too small to meet the family’s financial needs. Business is going well and she wants to increase her income to help support her husband.

She is asking for $525.00 as an additional capital to buy more food items for her food production and sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food items for her food production and sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44078

loans.name: Emokpae

texts.en: Mr. Emokpae P. is 37 years old, married, and has a child. He hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells notebooks and textbooks. He has been in this business since 2001. Mr. P. is requesting a loan of $875 to enable him to buy more notebooks and textbooks for sale. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy books for sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. sells corn and palm oil. She is married and has one child. Demand for her goods has increased but she lacks sufficient capital to enable her buy more goods for sale.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more corn and palm oil for sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more corn and palm oil for sale

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44080

loans.name: Fatuma Nasur`s Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 28, is the leader of this group.  Fatuma is married with four children. They are aged 13, 11, 8 and 1.7 years old. The three oldest children are in school.
Fatuma has just taken a loan for Shillings 800,000/=. She will use the loan to increase her stock of clothes and shoes. She hopes the increased profits will add to her savings so she can rent a shop in Kampala City Center.

The community she lives in is semi-urban.  The challenges she faces are the long distances she has to travel to get to her different distribution points, fatigue, staying away from home for most of the week and carrying her baby with her. 

Her children are able to go to boarding schools because of MCDT loans. She is also able to get the basic needs met for her family. Fatuma has also contributed to the procurement of a plot of land outside Kampala and has bought a motorcycle for public hire. She plans to rent a shop in Kampala City Center in order to reduce on the number of days that she stays away from home.  Fatuma has paid over ten loans back successfully to MCDT.

loans.use: To purchase new and secondhand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Emumuwean

texts.en: Emumuwean J. resides in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old, married and has 5 children. She bakes snacks with her husband and also sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She worked with Rayman Bakery for 3 years before she started on her own in 1995. Mrs. J. is focused and determined to enlarge her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more baking material and foodstuffs for her business. This will help her to better serve her customers. She thanks all who will make her loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more bakery material and foodstuffs

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana K. sells corn. She is married to a farmer and has five dependents. Her husband’s income is not enough to be relied upon. She is working very hard to contribute to the family’s finances. She wishes to increase sales but lacks enough fund to buy more goods.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more corn to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more corn for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44083

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. prepares food for sale. She is single and focused on expanding her business. Demand for her food has increased and she wishes to increase production.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more raw materials for her food production.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more raw materials for her food production.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44084

loans.name: Fatuma Nababi’S Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 40 years of age and married with nine children. They are aged 22, 18, 16, 14,10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years old. All of them are in school.
The community she lives in is semi-urban situated in a wetland that floods in the rainy season.
She is paying back a loan for Shillings 1,000,000/=, which she used for increasing her stock and paying school dues. She hopes to raise more profits from the increased stock.
Fatuma sells bananas for making a local food (matooke), and there is ready market for her merchandise
The main challenges are working in the open space and residing in an area, which is prone to flooding.
Her benefits include being able to take her children to school and fending for her family.. She also plans to buy a plot of land, build a house and move from the wetland. She would also like to shift to Kalerwe Market, where sales are deemed higher.
All of her previous loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with 2 sons. She and her family live in Novomoskovsk where Nadezhda runs a small business selling fresh meat and sausages at the central city market. This type of inventory always sells well as Ukrainian women love to cook and the cuisine in Ukraine offers many nourishing meals made with different meats. Nadezhda’s trade has been characterized by stability over the last 5 years. Presently, her business brings in about $300 a month in income.

Nadezhda has requested a loan to purchase new inventory items so she can continue developing her trade and feed her family. Additional financial assistance will help her to consistently build and manage her venture. We think Nadezhda, with her strong personality, high motivation, and passion to make a difference, will achieve success and repay the current loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Mary Nambalirwa`s Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of the group. She is 44 years of age and married with four children. They are ages 20, 18, 17, 15, years old. Three of them are in school and one dropped out due to lack of school fees.  The community she lives in is urban in a slum wetland area that floods in the rainy season.

She buys clothes and displays them in the market and has done this since she joined MCDT. She will use her loan to purchase a bale of clothes. 
There is market for her merchandise because of her low prices. The main challenges are working in the open space and residing in an area, which is prone to flooding.
Her benefits include being able to take her children to school and fending for her family. 
Plans include starting a wholesale shop for hardware and educating her children up to university level.
Mary has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To buy a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku D. is a pharmacist. He is married and has three children. Business is going well and he wishes to increase his inventory but lacks enough capital.

He is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more drugs for his pharmacy.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more drugs for his pharmacy

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44088

loans.name: Florence Kyaligonza`s Group

texts.en:
Florence is the leader of the group of five members. She is 48 years of age, a single mother with two children in school.  The community she lives in is urban in a slum wetland area that floods in the rainy season. Her main challenges are high transport and renting costs, stiff competition, working in the open space and residing in an area, which is prone to flooding. 

The benefits of her loan program include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family and she was able to buy a plot of land
Her plans include building a house with the money she earns from selling fuel and firewood.

Mary has successfully paid back 3 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Imelda Bulwadda`s Group

texts.en:
Imelda is the leader of a group with five members. She is 56 years of age and she is a widow with six children. They are ages 35, 33, 31, 25, and 23 years old (with a pair of twins). Two are in school and the rest are working.  The community she lives in is urban in a slum.

Her main challenges are petty thieves in the area, limited space to accommodate clients and the rainy season flooding the area. However, there is a ready market for her businesses.

Her benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family and being able to expand her business with the help of MCDT loans. She plans to grow her business by opening up a new eating-place.

Imelda has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loans.use: Opening a restaurant and selling soft drinks

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero I. is a strong woman. She lives in Benin City, where she sells cooked food, provisions and drinks to people in her community. She has been in this business since 2005. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. Mrs.I. is requesting a loan of $450 so she can buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more provision and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel E. is 37 years old, married and has a child. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling wood in her community since 2001. Mrs. E. is requesting for a loan of $1200 so she can buy more wood for her business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Sumiini Nabakiibi`s Group

texts.en:
Sumini is the leader of a group of five members. She is 40 years of age, married, with five children. They are ages 25, 23, 21, 19 and 17 years old. All are in school.  The community she lives in is urban in a slum.

The main challenges are the high prices of commodities. There is ready market for her businesses and her clients include people retiring from their working places to their homes.
Her benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family, and being able to build a 4-room house.

She plans to use her loan to expand her business and buy materials for constructing a house.

Sumini has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To expand business and buy materials for constructing a house

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: E. Ngozi is 27, married, and has 2 children. She is a fashion designer, and she sews in several different styles. Mrs. Ngozi has been a fashion designer since 2000 and she is determined to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 so she can buy more cloth and tailoring materials for the business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline E. is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells medicinal drugs and drinks. She has been a client of LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Mrs. E. is requesting a loan of $600 so she can buy more medicinal drugs and drinks for her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicinal drugs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Harriet Nansubuga`s Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the leader of a group of five members. She is 49 years of age, and a single mother with five children. They are ages 30, 28, 23, 18 and 20 years old. Three are in school and 2 are working. The community she lives in is semi-urban.

Her main challenges are the high prices of the vegetables especially in times of scarcity.  Her commodity is a perishable and she has to be in the market as early as 4.00am to buy produce from the farmers. However, there is ready market for her vegetables.

She used to sell cold drinks and tea in the taxi park before switching to selling vegetables. The benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family, being able to acquire household assets.

She plans to use her loan to expand business by opening a hardware shop and building a house.

She has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables and open a hardware shop

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica E. is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Mrs. E. sells bread. She has been in business since 1993 and has been a member of LAPO for the past 6 years.  She is requesting for a loan of $600 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen C. is 36 years old, married and has a child. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and sells wine, drinks, and provisions. She has been in business for 8 years. She is requesting for a loan of $450 so she can buy more provisions for her business. With this she will be able to better serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, wine, and drinks for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy U. is married and has 6 children. She is 48 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling foodstuffs and provisions in her shop since 1989. Mrs. U. is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a refrigerator for cooling drinks. In addition, with this loan she will be able to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a diligent mother of 2 young daughters. Her greatest wish is to provide her beloved offspring with a higher education so that they may carve out an exceptional future for themselves. With this aim in mind, this industrious woman eagerly sells orange juice on one of the most crowded streets in the city of Juliaca.
