Now that her young ones have started elementary school, she feels the need to look for a way to generate more income in order to support them and pay for their studies. For this reason, she plans on expanding and improving her facilities in order to offer her customers more comfort and security. In order to substantiate those plans, Nancy needs the help of your generous heart, and is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy es una diligente madre de 2 pequeñas niñas, su mayor anhelo es brindarles estudios superiores a sus queridos retoños con el fin de que a través de el puedan forjarse un futuro prodigioso, con ese objetivo en mente ésta diligente mujer se dedica con mucho más ahínco a su negocio de venta de jugo de naranja en forma ambulatoria, en una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca.Ahora que sus pequeños niños iniciaron sus estudios primarios se ve en la necesidad de buscar la manera de generar mayores ingresos para su manutención y educación, es por ello que tiene pensado ampliar y mejorar su pequeña instalación para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad y seguridad.Para concretar sus planes Nancy requiere de la ayuda de tu generoso corazón y te hace la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital for improving her service

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is thirty-four years old, married and a mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. She has been selling oranges in Mankessim, a fishing community, for twelve years.  
Ophelia wants to use her loan to purchase more bags of oranges so that she can supply to other retailers.  It would also help her get a discount when she buys in bulk.

She is a member of the group called St. Jude.  Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bags of oranges

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Michael E

texts.en: Michael E Usiaghan is married with 3 children. He is 48 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. Mr. Usiaghan has been publishing and selling books since 2004. He is requesting a loan of $450 so he can buy a printer for his business. He thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy a printer for my shop

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a married woman with five children.  Her children are currently in school. She is forty-three years old and has been preparing and selling owaakye (brown rice cooked with beans) in Mankessim for the past ten years. It is a very nutritious dish eaten by almost all Ghanaians.  It is in very high demand.
Salamatu says that prices of her ingredients like spices, vegetables, beans and rice have gone up.  She wants use her loan to buy her products in larger quantities to avoid price hikes.
She is a member of the group called St. Jude. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, vegetables, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Dorothy Namata`s Group

texts.en:
The main challenges are the fast perishing of these vegetables in the extreme conditions of heat and coldness, selling along the roadside in open space and having to be in the market as early as 4.00a.m in the morning to buy them from the farmers for resale. There is ready market for her business but profits reduce during times of surplus harvests.

Her benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family and paying rent for residential and work places and built a three-roomed house.

Plans to expand business by opening a retail shop construct a semi-permanent wooden structure to work from and build a house in order to stop paying rent.

She has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Natty

texts.es:
Natty’s greatest wish is to become a successful professional so that her beloved parents can be proud of her. With this goal in mind, she works hard daily and tries to do her best in all of the activities in which she is involved. Natty is originally from the province of Macusani, but over 6 years ago, she moved to Juliaca, where she is obtaining her professional degree thanks to her dear parents’ support. A few years ago, after much discussion, they decided to open a mini market, which helps them meet their most urgent needs and pay for her studies. Upon seeing the demand and the ever-rising cost of basic foodstuff, they would like to increase their stock. They believe that with this investment, they will be able to increase their earnings and keep the prices down for better customer satisfaction. Your indispensable contribution will permit Natty’s plans to materialize.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El deseo más gran de Natty es convertirse en una exitosa profesional para que sus queridos padres se sientan orgullosos de ella, con este objetivo en mente se esfuerza a diario y trata de dar lo mejor de sí en cada una de las actividades que desarrolla.Natty es natural de la provincia de Macusani pero hace más de 6 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar en el que estudia una carrera profesional gracias al apoyo incondicional de sus queridos padres. Hace algunos años decidieron después de mucho diálogo abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes, tiendita con el que están logrando solventar sus necesidades más urgentes y su educación, ahora viendo la demanda y el elevado costo que día a día van adquiriendo los productos de primera necesidad desean aumentar el stock de su mercadería, consideran que haciendo esta inversión lograrán mejorar sus ingresos económicos y mantener los precios para mayor comodidad de sus clientes.“Tu indispensable aporte permitirá concretar los planes de Natty”

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of basic foodstuff

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44105

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate I. is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. Mrs. I. is a hair stylist who has been in business since 2005. She is requesting  a loan of $450 to buy weavons for her business. She will also buy a generator so she can work any time, as the electric supply where she lives is not regular. She thanks you in advance for the help.

loans.use: To buy weavons and a generator

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is a cheerful woman who is much-loved by her family and in the workplace. She is originally from the district of Arequipa, but due to work issues, she now lives in the city of Juliaca. She finished her technical degree, but because of the lack of job opportunities, she is not able to put her profession into practice. A few years ago, she and her husband separated. Now, this diligent mother of a charming 8-year-old girl decided to sell party gowns and suits. Thanks to her patience and her wide selection of the most exclusive styles, her shop is now greatly frequented, allowing her to considerably improve her profits. Lidia plans on purchasing a greater variety of party accessories and exclusive gown and three-piece suit designs, with the aim of satisfying all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia es una mujer muy alegre y querida dentro de su entorno laboral y familiar, es natural del departamento de Arequipa pero por cuestiones laborales radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, terminó una carrera técnica pero por falta de oportunidades de trabajo no puede desenvolverse.Hace algunos años se separó de su esposo y actualmente esta diligente madre de una encantadora niña de 8 años decidió alquilar un local y poner su tienda de alquiler y venta de vestidos y trajes para fiestas, gracias a la paciencia con la que atiende y a la selección de los más exclusivos modelos de vestidos con los que cuenta en su establecimiento, está siendo muy concurrida y visitada, permitiéndole mejorar considerablemente sus ingresos económicos.Lidia tiene pensado adquirir mayor variedad de accesorios para fiestas y diseños exclusivos de vestidos y ternos, con el fin de complacer a todos sus clientes.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase a greater quantity of apparel to satisfy her customers

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44107

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty O. is a mother with three children. She is thirty-nine years old and has been selling second hand clothing in Mankessim for the last three years. She travels to Accra every three days to buy the clothes.
Gifty wants to use her loan to purchase more bales of clothing to reduce her frequent travel to Accra and also avoid price hikes.  This will allow her to save some money.
She a member of the group called Lamb of God.  Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia has always been a very responsible woman. Despite the difficulties she has faced in life, she has never given up on moving forwards with her two children, who are her reason to live. This selfless mother currently lives with her children in a small, rented house in the city of Juliaca, which is where she decided to set up her small grocery store. Thanks to the range of products and, above all, to the good service she offers, she managed to gain a set of regular customers within a very short period of time. Her customers are now asking her to enlarge her store so that she can offer other products such as fruit and vegetables. With this project in mind, Antonia is coming back to ask if you can grant her the loan to turn her project into a reality.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Antonia siempre ha demostrado ser una madre muy responsable, pese a los momentos difíciles que le ha tocado enfrentar en la vida, nunca ha perdido la esperanza de seguir adelante junto a sus 2 hijos quienes son la razón de su vida. Esta Abnegada madre actualmente vive junto a sus hijos en una pequeña casita alquilada en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde decidió abrir e implementar poco a poco su bodeguita de abarrotes, gracias a la variedad de productos que ofrece y sobre todo a la buena atención que brinda en corto tiempo logró obtener asiduos clientes, clientes que ahora le solicitan ampliar su tiendita para ofrecer otros productos como verduras y frutas.Con ese proyecto en mente doña Antonia recurre a ti a fin de solicitarte un préstamo y posibilitar su proyecto.

loans.use: Increase in working capital to expand the range of products.

loans.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Eseosa O. is 32 years old, married, and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells lengths of cloth called wrappers that are worn by wrapping them around the body. She has been in business since 2003. Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of $700 to help her buy more wrappers. She is grateful to all who will make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers for sale

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia is a very caring woman, as voiced by her friends and clients. She is very hard-working, cheerful and enterprising. Through hard labour she raised her children by herself and they have grown to become profesional and self-supporting men. This exemplary mother currently has a small space, selling groceries in one of the most busy avenues in the city of Juliaca. Her business manages to cover her most basic needs, as well those of her elderly mother. She is now returning to ask for a loan so that she can expand her range of products, including soft drinks. Eusebia expects her economic situation to improve as a result of this investment.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Eusebia, como cariñosamente la suelen llamar sus amigos y clientes, es una mujer muy trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora, sola ha sacado adelante a sus queridos hijos y con su ardua labor los ha convertido en excelentes profesionales y hombres independientes.Esta ejemplar madre actualmente tiene un pequeño espacio de ventas de comestibles en una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, negocio con el que esta logrando cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes y la de su anciana madre, en esta oportunidad recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo para aumentar la variedad de sus productos y ofertar también bebidas gaseosas, Eusebia cree que con esta inversión mejorará sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Capital injection to expand her range of products.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44111

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has been selling gari (milled and roasted cassava), salt, maize and earthenware bowls in Mankessim for the past eight years. She is thirty-four years and a mother of three children.  Her children are all currently in school.
Hannah wants to use her loan to purchase more maize, gari and earthenware bowls for the lean season.  This would enable her to avoid price hikes which affect the other products she sells.
She is a member of the group called Lamb of God. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more gari, salt and earthenware bowls

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells food stuffs. She is married and has four dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Esi is working very hard to contribute to the family’s expenses.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more food stuffs to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food stuffs for sale

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44113

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José has always had a special talent for cooking and currently expresses it in each one of his delicious stews, which charm the palates of his demanding clientele. The knowledge that he has gained and now puts into practice is the result of training from his adorable mother. Unfortunately, José wasn’t able to complete his high school education as he comes from a family with little economic resouces. However, in the preparation of delicious meals, he found his way to move forward, together with his two lovely children. He currently rents small premises which he runs as a restaurant. His much bigger wish, which lies at the bottom of his heart, is to have his own premises so that he can provide more comfort to himself and his demanding clientele. With this goal in mind, he is putting most of his effort into the preparation of every dish he prepares so that he can gain more clientele and increase his family income and his children’s quality of life.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Don José siempre tuvo un talento especial para la cocina, actualmente ese don lo plasma en cada uno de los deliciosos potajes que prepara para deleitar el paladar de su exigente clientela. Los conocimientos que aprendió y ahora pone en práctica son productos de las enseñanzas de su adorable madre, lamentablemente no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios porque provenía de una familia de escasos recursos económicos, pero encontró en la preparación de deliciosos platillos la manera de salir adelante junto a sus dos queridos hijos.Actualmente tiene un pequeño local alquilado en donde funciona su restaurante, el deseo más grande que alberga su corazón es tener su propio local para su mayor comodidad y la de su exigente clientela, con ese propósito en mente pone su mayor esfuerzo en la preparación de cada platillo que prepara para así incrementar su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos económicos y la calidad de vida de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Capital injection to set up a restaurant in his own premises.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is thirty-three years old, married and a mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She sells onions, beans and sugar in the Mankessim market.

Efua wants to use her loan to buy more sugar, beans and onions to avoid price hikes and reduce her frequent travel to Takyiman, which is in the northern part of Ghana, for her products.

She is a proud member of the group called “Gyedzi,” which means believe. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more onions, beans and sugar

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Comite Ko´e Pyahu Group

texts.es:
This group from Barrio San Juan Miguel, district of Cambryeta was created from another group in the same neighborhood. The required meeting to put this group together was done and currently it is composed of 16 hard-working women.

These ladies' activities consists of: convenience stores, dressmakers, general merchandise retail, fruits and vegetables sellers, fabric and clothing retailers, photocopiers, street market retailers and others.

Each applicant receives the amount od 530,000 Gs. This money will be applied to expand their businesses, in other words, to purchase more merchandise and goods such as, clothes and shoes, purchase seeds for cultivation, purchase flour, baked pastries, canned goods, rice, noodles, dairy and assorted beverages; purchase fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, elastic, zippers and others.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Este comité del Barrio San Juan San Miguel del distrito de Cambyreta ha surgido por contacto de otro grupo formado en el mismo barrio. Se han realizado las reuniones requeridas para la conformación del Comité y actualmente el mismo esta integrado por 16 mujeres trabajadoras.

Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: despensas, costureras, venta de mercaderías varias, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de telas y ropas, fotocopiadora, puesto de ventas en la feria, y otros.

Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de 530.000 Gs. El destino de estos créditos son para ampliar sus negocios, es decir para la compra de mas mercaderías e insumos como ser: telas, hilos, botones, elásticos, cierres, harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas, prendas de vestir, calzados, semillas para cultivar, etc.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes; purchase seeds for cultivation; purchase flour, baked pastries, canned goods, rice, noodles, dairy and assorted beverages; purchase fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, elastic, zippers and others

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate P. sells second-hand clothing. She is married and has three children. Her husband drives a commercial vehicle and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She is helping her husband with the family expenses. She wishes to increase her income but doesn't have enough capital.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more second-hand clothing to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44117

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is forty-nine years old and a father of three children. He is married and has been preparing and selling herbal medicine in his community of Mankessim for the past thirty years.
He wants to use his loan to prepare more medicine so that he can ultimately rent a store to sell his products. Currently, he hawks his products.

He is a member of the group called Stewards. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to prepare more medicine and rent a store for his operations

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)
